p.seg: בצל סכנת הכחדה: שלושה גורי ברדלס נולדו באיראן
החיה המהירה בעולם נופלת קורבן לציד אכזרי, לבצורות ולתאונות דרכים קטלניות ברחבי הרפובליקה האסלאמית •
בעקבות כך צנח מספרם לפחות מ-20 ברדלסים.
שלושה גורי ברדלס אסייתי הגיחו לאחרונה לאוויר העולם ברפובליקה האסלאמית של איראן.
זוהי לידה נדירה, שמשפרת רק במעט את מצבה הטרגי של החיה הנמצאת בסכנת הכחדה במדינה בעקבות בצורות, ציידים ותאונות דרכים קטלניות.
מדובר בלידה ראשונה של ברדלס בשבי באיראן.
יש לציין כי הרפובליקה האסלאמית היא אחת מהמדינות האחרונות בעולם שבהן ברדלסים עוד חיים בטבע.
בסוכנות הידיעות האיראנית "אירנא" דווח כי הצוות הווטרינרי, האמון על הפארק הלאומי תוראן שבמחוז סמנאן הצפוני, החליט על לידה קיסרית בשבי.
עוד צוין כי תועדו בתקופה האחרונה פחות מ-20 ברדלסים בשבעה מחוזות שונים במדינה.
בעקבות הסכנה להכחדתם, האו"ם הוציא לפועל תוכנית הגנה עבורם עוד בשנת 2001.
כעת, באיראן מקווים שהגורים החדשים יוכלו להביא בעתיד לגידול באוכלוסיית הברדלסים.
בחודש ינואר האחרון אמר סגן השר לענייני סביבה באיראן, חסן אכברי, כי אוכלוסיית הברדלסים במדינה הצטמצמה באופן דרמטי מ-100 ברדלסים בשנת 2010 ל-12 ברדלסים בלבד.
"המצב שלהם חמור באופן קיצוני", אמר אכברי וציין כי הברדלסים נפלו קורבן לבצורת באזורי המחיה שלהם, לציד ואף לתאונות דרכים.
הברדלס נחשב לחיה המהירה בעולם שמסוגלת להגיע למהירות של כ-100 קמ"ש.
את הברדלסים ניתן למצוא במקומות שונים על פני הגלובוס, מהודו ועד סנגל שבמערב אפריקה.
Under the threat of extinction: three cheetah cubs were born in Iran
The fastest animal in the world falls victim to brutal hunting, droughts and fatal road accidents throughout the Islamic Republic •
As a result, their number dropped to less than 20 cheetahs.
Three Asiatic cheetah cubs recently emerged into the world in the Islamic Republic of Iran.
This is a rare birth, which only slightly improves the tragic situation of the animal, which is in danger of extinction in the country due to droughts, hunters and fatal road accidents.
This is the first birth of cheetahs in captivity in Iran.
It should be noted that the Islamic Republic is one of the last countries in the world where cheetahs still live in the wild.
The Iranian news agency, "IRNA", reported that the veterinary team, in charge of the Turan National Park in the northern Samnan district, decided on a cesarean delivery in captivity.
It was also noted that less than 20 cheetahs were recorded in the last period in seven different districts of the country.
Following the danger of their extinction, the UN implemented a protection plan for them back in 2001.
Now, in Iran they hope that the new cubs can lead to an increase in the cheetah population in the future.

Last January, the Deputy Minister of Environmental Affairs in Iran, Hassan Akbari, said that the population of cheetahs in the country has decreased dramatically from 100 cheetahs in 2010 to only 12 cheetahs.
"Their situation is extremely serious", Akbari said, noting that the cheetahs fell victim to drought in their living habitats, hunting and even road accidents.
The cheetah is considered the fastest animal in the world, capable of reaching a speed of about 100 km/h.
Cheetahs can be found in various places across the globe, from India to Senegal in West Africa.

ספוטיפיי רוצה לשדרג לכם את הרכב: בדקנו את ה-Car Thing
בשקט בשקט, ספוטיפיי החלה לנסות את מזלה גם בעולם החומרה •
אחרי שנים של פיתוח - Car Thing נחשף והושק כניסוי קטן בארה"ב •
שמנו יד על המכשיר הראשון בישראל •
החזון: להפוך את הרכבים הישנים שלכם לחכמים
ה-Car Thing הוא מוצר החומרה הראשון של ספוטיפיי, ונבנה במיוחד על מנת לספק פתרון לאנשים בעלי רכבים ישנים.
לפני כמה שבועות, קיבלתי הזדמנות ראשונית לנסות את המוצר החדש, שזמין כרגע רק לנסיינים בודדים בארה"ב, כאן בישראל.
עבורי, הטיימינג של המשלוח היה יוצא מן הכלל, שכן הרכב הביתי שלנו התקלקל ונאלצנו לנהוג במשך כמה ימים עם רכב חליפי בעל מערכת ישנה.
אחרי שבועיים של השתעשעות, הבנתי כיצד ה-Car Thing יכול להפוך בקלות לחלק בלתי נפרד מהמערכת של אנשים רבים.
ומנגד, עם רשימת המתנה ארוכה וחוסר וודאות בנוגע להשקה עולמית, אני מאמין שרבים יעדיפו כבר להשתמש בפתרונות אחרים.
מרעיון למציאות
אי שם בשנת 2018, משתמשי ספוטיפיי החלו לקבל הצעה מעניינת בתיבת האימייל שלהם - אפשרות לרכוש מכשיר חדש עם שליטה קולית וחיבוריות דור רביעי, שיהפוך כל מערכת ישנה לרכב לחכמה.
השמועות אט אט דעכו עד שנה לאחר מכן, כשאתר Financial Times חשף כי החברה מתכננת להציג בקרוב מוצר חדש לרכב המדמה רדיו חכם עם חיבוריות בלוטות'.
כמה חודשים לאחר מכן, השמועות הללו חזרו שוב לכותרות אחרי ששירות המוזיקה התעדכן עם מצב הרכב - אותו אחד שאנו מכירים כיום מהאפליקציה - המופעל ברגע שהסמארטפון מזהה חיבור למערכת באוטו.
שנתיים עברו מאז.
אחרי אינספור שמועות והדלפות, ספוטיפיי חשפה בחודש אפריל האחרון את "Car Thing", המערכת החכמה שלה לכלי רכב.
ספוטיפיי בחרה לשחרר את המכשיר החדש באופן מוגבל מאוד, עם רשימת המתנה ארוכה ועיכובים רבים בכל הנוגע למשלוחים.
אז כמובן, מיד אחרי מסיבת העיתונאים שקיימה, נכנסתי לאתר ונרשמתי.
חודשיים לאחר מכן, ההודעה המיוחלת הגיעה.
התחברות מחודשת לאתר תקנה לי את האפשרות לרכוש את המכשיר עם הפתעה קטנה - הוא לא יעלה לי דבר.
אחרי חודש נוסף של המתנה, השליח סוף סוף דפק לי בדלת, מלווה בקופסה קטנה עם הלוגו של ספוטיפיי עליה.
ה-Car Thing
בראש ובראשונה, המכשיר של ספוטיפיי הרשים אותי מאוד באיכות הבנייה שלו.
וא מעט יותר קטן מהאייפון 11 שלי וכולל בקדמתו מסך מגע גדול, בהיר וחד משציפיתי.
כמו כן, תוכלו למצוא לצד המסך כפתור עגול וחוגה שתוכלו לסובב כדי לנווט בין מסכי הממשק.
ולמרות החוגה הענקית, אותה אתם יכולים לראות בתמונות, ה-Car Thing מצליח לשמור על פרופיל דקיק יחסית ולא לבלוט יותר מדי מהדשבורד.
באופן אישי, הייתי מעדיף שהחברה תאפשר לשנות את פעילות החוגה על מנת שאוכל לשלוט בווליום של הסמארטפון, שכן אני יכול לנווט גם באמצעות מסך המגע.
אולי זה יתאפשר בעדכון גרסה עתידי.
המכשיר מגיע בקופסת קרטון קטנה ומינימליסטית, הכוללת בין היתר כבל USB Type C ומתאמים שונים להתקנתו.
רבים מכם בטח זוכרים כיצד בעבר היינו נוהגים לנתק את מכשירי הרדיו ולהחביא אותם במגירה אחרי היציאה מהרכב.
ה-Car Thing ללא ספק מחזיר את ההרגשה הזאת עם צורת הבנייה שלו.
כלל המתאמים התחברו לגוף המכשיר באמצעות מגנט שהיה חזק מאוד, מה שמנע ממנו ליפול גם בעת נסיעה על כבישי עפר.
נוסף על כך, לאורך כל חלקו העליון ניתן למצוא כפתורים קטנים, אותם אפשר להגדיר בקלות להפעלת פלייליסטים שונים או פודקאסטים.
באמצעות לחיצה ארוכה על אחד מהכפתורים בזמן השמיעה, או באמצעות בקשה מהעוזרת הקולית, הגדרתי כמה פלייליסטים שאני שומע באופן תכוף ואת תכנית הרדיו שאני מאזין לה מדי בוקר בדרכים.
בכך, הפיצ'ר גרם לי להרגיש שה-Car Thing הוא יותר כמו רדיו לרכב מאשר הרחבה של הסמארטפון שלי.
מרכב ישן לרכב חכם
אחרי התקנה פיזית פשוטה למדי, חיברתי את ה-Car Thing לחשמל.
הופתעתי לטובה מתהליך ההגדרה.
ההוראות היו ברורות, החיבור לאפליקציית ספוטיפיי לקח פחות מ-5 דקות, וכמה רגעים לאחר מכן הגעתי למסך הבית.
למעשה, המכשיר מתחבר לסמארטפון דרך בלוטות' ושולט על האפליקציה כמו שלט, ולכן יכול להעתיק ממנה את כל המידע על החשבון שלנו.
משמע, עדיין תהיו חייבים לחבר את הסמארטפון שלכם לרכב, בין אם דרך בלוטות' או דרך כבל AUX על מנת לשמוע את המוזיקה.
מסך הבית מוכר לכל המשתמשים באפליקציה, שכן כמו היישום בסמארטפון, הוא שם דגש על תמונות האלבומים ורשימות ההשמעה.
כמו כן, במסך הבית, כמו זה שבאפליקציה, תוכלו למצוא המלצות למוזיקה בהתאם לטעם שלכם, את מסך החיפוש ואת הספריה האישית שלכם.
כאמור, תוכלו לנווט בין המסכים השונים באמצעות מסך המגע או באמצעות המחוגה הידנית.
יתרה מכך, תוכלו בכל רגע נתון לקרוא לעוזרת הקולית של המכשיר באמצעות אמירת "היי ספוטיפיי".
באמצעותה, תוכלו להפעיל שירים, פלייליסטים, אלבומים ואפילו לחפש פודקאסטים.
מניסוני היא זיהתה די בקלות את הקול שלי גם כשהמוזיקה התנגנה ברקע והמזגן נשף ישירות על המכשיר.
זאת ככל הנראה הודות לארבעת המיקרופונים שהותקנו בחלקו העליון.
חשוב לציין שכרגע העוזרת הקולית אינה תומכת בעברית, ונכון לעת פרסום הכתבה, אין מידע על מתי עדכון שכזה יגיע.
אז האם שווה לחכות לו?
חוויית השימוש שלי במכשיר הייתה נהדרת, וזו הפתעה חיובית בעיניי בהתחשב בכך שהוא עדיין בשלב שחרור ראשוני.
גם בשימוש אינטנסיבי בנסיעות ארוכות, המכשיר המשיך לעבוד בצורה חלקה מבלי להתנתק מהסמארטפון שלי.
בכל זאת, מדי פעם נרשם גמגום קטן בממשק, אבל אני מאמין שספוטיפיי תטפל בבאגים שכאלה עם עדכוני גרסה עתידיים.
ניכר שהחברה השבדית עבדה עליו הרבה בשנים האחרונות, ומבין הגרסאות השונות שדלפו באינטרנט בתקופה הזו, העיצוב של המוצר הסופי הוא כנראה האהוב עליי.
עדיין, כשראיתי את ה-Car Thing בפעם הראשונה, תהיתי למי בדיוק החברה מנסה לייעד אותו.
הרי פעילותו מסתכמת בשליטה על האפליקציה בסמארטפון, ולא הרבה מעבר לזה.
מה זה שונה מלקנות מעמד לרכב בכמה שקלים ולחבר אותו כך שהסמארטפון יהיה קרוב יותר אלינו בעת נהיגה?
השאלה הזו מתחזקת בעת התחשבות בכך שמכשירי אייפון ואנדרואיד חזקים בהרבה מזה של ספוטיפיי, וברוב הפעמים יקנו למשתמש הרבה יותר פונקציונליות.
למרות כל זאת, ככל שהשתמשתי ב-Car Thing יותר ויותר, הבנתי כיצד ביכולתו לשפר את חוויית הנהיגה.
היכולת לראות את ה-Waze על גבי מסך הסמארטפון שלי ולשלוט במוזיקה על גבי מסך אחר לחלוטין, זו אחת שלמדתי להעריך בשבועיים האחרונים.
שאלה אחת נותרה - האם ספוטיפיי בכלל תשיק את המכשיר לקהל הרחב?
ואם כן, האם הוא יושק גם כאן במדינתנו הקטנה?
החברה השבדית לא מספרת כרגע הרבה.
היא אפילו לא שיתפה כמה נסיינים למכשיר היא מפעילה כרגע ברחבי העולם, וכמה היא מתכננת להוסיף בהשקה המצומצמת בארצות הברית.
הדבר היחיד שאנו יודעים בוודאות זה המחיר שצפוי לעמוד על 79 דולרים (כ-255 שקלים).
לבינתיים, ה-Car Thing מספק הצצה ראשונית לקונספט שספוטיפיי מנסים לפצח כבר שנים.
מספוטיפיי ישראל נמסר כי אין מידע כרגע על תכנית להשקת המכשיר בארץ
Spotify wants to upgrade your car: we tested the Car Thing
Quietly, Spotify began trying to enter the hardware world as well •
After years of development—Car Thing was revealed and launched as a small experiment in the USA •
We got a hold on the first device in Israel •
The vision: to make your old vehicles smart
The Car Thing is Spotify’s first hardware product, and was built specifically to provide a solution for people with old cars.
A few weeks ago, I got an preliminary opportunity to try out the new product here in Israel, which is currently only available to individual testers in the US.
For me, the timing of the delivery was incredible, as our home vehicle broke down and we had to drive for several days with a replacement vehicle equipped with an old system.
After two weeks of trying it, I came to understand how Car Thing could easily become an integral part of many people’s systems.
On the other hand, with a long waiting list and uncertainty regarding a global launch, I believe that many will already prefer to use other solutions.
From idea to reality

Somewhere in 2018, Spotify users began to receive an interesting offer in their email inbox—an opportunity to purchase a new device with voice control and 4th generation connectivity, which will make any old car system smart.

The rumors slowly died down until a year later, when the Financial Times website revealed that the company was planning to soon introduce a new car product simulating a smart radio with Bluetooth connectivity.

A few months later, these rumors made headlines again after the music service was updated with the vehicle mode—the same one we know today from the app—which is activated as soon as the smartphone detects a connection to the system in the car.
Two years have passed since then.
After countless rumors and leaks, Spotify revealed "Car Thing" in last April, its smart system for vehicles.
Spotify chose to release the new device in a very limited edition, with a long waiting list and many delays when it comes to shipments.
So of course, right after the press conference that took place, I entered the website and registered.
Two months later, the long-awaited announcement arrived.
Reconnecting to the website will give me the opportunity to purchase the device with a small surprise—it won’t cost me a thing.
After another month of waiting, the courier finally knocked on my door, accompanied by a small box with the Spotify logo on it.
The Car Thing
First and foremost, Spotify’s device impressed me greatly with its structure materials quality.
It is slightly smaller than my iPhone 11 and has a larger, brighter and sharper touch screen than I expected on its front
You will also find a round button and a dial next to the screen that allows you to navigate between the interface screens.
And despite the huge dial, which you can see in the pictures, the Car Thing manages to keep a relatively thin profile and not stand out too much from the dashboard.
Personally, I would have preferred the company to allow changing the dial activity so that I’ll be able to control the smartphone volume, since I can also navigate using the touch screen.
Maybe this will be enabled in a future version update.
The device comes in a small and minimalist cardboard box, which also includes, a USB Type C cable and various adapters for its installation.
Many of you probably remember how in the past we used to disconnect the radios and hide them in a drawer after leaving the car.
The Car Thing certainly brings back that feeling with its construction.
All the adapters connected to the device with a very strong magnet, which prevented it from falling even while driving on dirt roads.
In addition, along its entire upper part you can find small buttons, which can be easily configured to activate different playlists or podcasts.
By long-pressing one of the buttons while listening, or by asking the voice assistant, I set some playlists that I listen to frequently and the radio program that I listen to every morning on the go.
In doing so, the feature made me feel like the Car Thing is more like a car radio than an extension of my smartphone.
From an old car to a smart one
After a fairly simple physical setup, I plugged in the Car Thing.
I was pleasantly surprised by the setup process.
The instructions were clear, connecting to the Spotify app took less than 5 minutes, and a few moments later I reached the home screen.
In fact, the device connects to the smartphone via Bluetooth and controls the application like a remote control, and therefore can copy all the information about our account from it.
Meaning, you will still have to connect your smartphone to the car, either via Bluetooth or via an AUX cable in order to hear the music.
The home screen is familiar to all users of the application, since like the smartphone application, it emphasizes the album images and playlists.
Also, on the home screen, like the one in the application, you can find music recommendations according to your liking, the search screen and your personal library.
As mentioned, you can navigate between the different screens using the touch screen or the manual dial.
Moreover, at any given moment, you can call the device’s voice assistant by saying "Hey Spotify".
Using it, you can play songs, playlists, albums and even search for podcasts.
In my experience, the voice assistant recognized my voice quite easily even when the music was playing in the background and the air conditioner was blowing directly on the device.
This is probably thanks to the four microphones installed in the upper part.
It is important to note that currently the voice assistant does not support Hebrew, and as of the time of publishing the article, there is no information on when such an update will arrive.
So is it worth waiting for?
My user experience of the device was great, and this is quite a surprise for me considering that this is still in an initial release stage.
Even for intensive use on long trips, the device continued to work smoothly without disconnecting off my smartphone.
Still, every now and then a small glitch in the interface occurs, but I believe that Spotify will address such bugs in future version updates.

Evidently the Swedish company has labored on the device recent years, and this final design of the product is probably my favorite among the different versions that have leaked online during this period.
Still, when I first saw the Car Thing, I wondered to whom exactly was the company trying to target it to.
After all, its activity amounts to controlling the application on the smartphone, and not much else.
How is this different from buying a cheap car stand and connecting it so that the smartphone stands closer to us while driving?
This question gets crucial when considering that iPhone and Android devices are much more powerful than Spotify’s device, and in most cases will supply the user with much more functionality.
Despite this, as I used Car Thing more frequently, I came to understand how it may improve the driving experience.
Being able to view the Waze app on my smartphone screen and control the music on a completely different screen is one feature I’ve come to appreciate in the last couple of weeks.
One question remains—will Spotify even launch the device to the general public?
And if so, will it also be launched here in our small country?
The Swedish company is not saying much at the moment.
It hasn’t even shared how many testers for the device it’s currently running around the world, and how many devices will Spotify add in to the limited launch in the United States.
The only thing we validate is the expected price of 79 dollars (about 255 NIS).
Meanwhile, the Car Thing provides a first look at a concept that Spotify has been trying to crack for years.
Spotify Israel stated that there is currently no information about a plan to launch the device in Israel

Moreover, you can at any given moment call the device's voice assistant by saying "Hey Spotify."
With it, you can play songs, playlists, albums, and even search for podcasts.
From Sony, she recognized my voice quite easily even when the music was playing in the background and the air conditioner was blowing directly on the device.
This is probably due to the four microphones installed at the top.

It is important to note that at the moment the voice assistant does not support Hebrew, and as of the time of publication of the article, there is no information about when such an update will arrive.
So is it worth waiting for him?
My experience of using the device was great, which is a positive surprise to me given that it's still in an initial release phase.
Even with intensive use on long journeys, the device continued to work smoothly without disconnecting from my smartphone.
Still, from time to time there is a small stutter in the interface, but I believe that Spotify will address such bugs with future version updates.

It is evident that the Swedish company has worked on it a lot in recent years, and among the various versions that have leaked on the Internet during this period, the design of the final product is probably my favorite.
Still, when I saw the Car Thing for the first time, I wondered who exactly the company was trying to designate it for.
After all, his activity boils down to controlling the app on the smartphone, and not much beyond that.
How is it different from buying a car stand for a few shekels and connecting it so that the smartphone is closer to us when driving?
That question is reinforced when considering that iPhones and Android devices are much more powerful than Spotify's, and most times will buy the user a lot more functionality.
Despite all this, as I used Car Thing more and more, I realized how it could improve the driving experience.
Being able to see the Waze on my smartphone screen and control the music on a completely different screen, is one I've learned to appreciate over the past two weeks.
One question remains - will Spotify even launch the device to the general public?
And if so, will it be launched here in our small country as well?
The Swedish company is not telling much at the moment.
It hasn't even shared how many experimenters for the device it's currently running around the world, and how many it plans to add in the limited launch in the United States.
The only thing we know for sure is that the price is expected to be $79.
In the meantime, the Car Thing provides an initial glimpse of a concept that Spotify has been trying to crack for years.
Spotify Israel said that there is currently no information about a plan to launch the device in Israel.

Quietly, Spotify began to try its luck in the hardware world.

We've got our hands on the first device in Israel
The vision: make your old cars smart.
Car Thing is Spotify's first hardware product, and it's built specifically to provide a solution for people with old cars.
A few weeks ago, I had the first opportunity to try the new product, which is currently only available to a select few in the United States, here in Israel.
For me, the timing of the delivery was exceptional, since our home car broke down and we had to drive for a few days in a replacement car with an old system.
After two weeks of fun, I realized how easily the Car Thing can become an integral part of many people's systems.
On the other hand, with the long waiting list and the uncertainty of a global launch, I believe many would prefer to use other solutions.
From Idea to Reality

Sometime in 2018, Spotify users started getting an interesting offer in their email inbox -- the option to buy a new device with voice control and fourth-generation connectivity that would turn any old system into a smart car.

The rumors slowly died down until a year later, when the Financial Times revealed that the company was planning to soon introduce a new product for a smart radio simulation vehicle with glandular connections.

A few months later, these rumors made headlines again after the music service updated the car's status -- the same one we know today from the app -- which is activated as soon as the smartphone detects a connection to the car's system.
It's been two years.
After countless rumors and leaks, Spotify unveiled Car Thing last April, its smart car system.
Spotify has chosen to release the new device in a very limited release, with a long waiting list and many delays in shipping.

Two months later, the long-awaited message arrived.
Reconnecting to the site will buy me the option to purchase the device with a little surprise - it won't cost me anything.
After another month of waiting, the courier finally knocked on my door, accompanied by a little box with the Spotify logo on it.
The Car Thing.
First of all, the Spotify device really impressed me with its build quality.
And it's a little bit smaller than my iPhone 11 and it has a bigger, brighter, more compact touchscreen on the front than I expected.
You'll also find a round button and a circle next to the screen that you can rotate to navigate between the interface screens.
And despite the giant circle, which you can see in the pictures, the Car Thing manages to keep a relatively thin profile and not stand out too much from the dashboard.
Personally, I'd prefer if the company allowed me to change the activity of the loop so that I could control the volume of the smartphone, because I can also navigate through the touchscreen.
Maybe this will be possible in a future update.
The device comes in a small, minimalist cardboard box, which includes a USB Type-C cable and various adapters for its installation.
Many of you probably remember how we used to turn off the radios and hide them in the drawer after we got out of the car.
The Car Thing definitely brings that feeling back with its construction.
All the adapters connected to the body of the device by a magnet that was very strong, which prevented it from falling even when driving on dirt roads.
In addition, along the top you can find small buttons, which can be easily set to play different playlists or podcasts.

By long pressing of one of the buttons while listening, or by requesting from the voice assistant, I set some playlists that I hear frequently and the radio program that I listen to every morning on the road.
In doing so, the feature made me feel that the Car Thing is more like a car radio than an extension of my smartphone.
From old car to smart car
After a fairly simple physical installation, I connected the Car Thing to electricity.
I was surprised at the quality of the setup process.
The instructions were clear, it took less than five minutes to sign in to Spotify, and a few moments later I was on my home screen.
In fact, the device connects to the smartphone through a node and controls the app like a control panel, so it can copy all of our account information from it.
So you'll still have to connect your smartphone to the car, whether it's through a spindle or through an AUX cable to hear the music.

However, there have been occasional slight glitches in the interface, but I believe Spotify will address such bugs with future release updates.

You will also find a round button and a dial next to the screen that you can turn to navigate between the interface screens.
And despite the huge dial, which you can see in the pictures, the Car Thing manages to keep a relatively thin profile and not stand out too much from the dashboard.
Personally, I would have preferred the company to allow changing the activity of the dial so that I can control the volume of the smartphone, since I can also navigate using the touch screen.
Maybe this will be enabled in a future version update.
The device comes in a small and minimalist cardboard box, which includes, among other things, a USB Type C cable and various adapters for its installation.
Many of you probably remember how in the past we used to disconnect the radios and hide them in a drawer after leaving the car.
The Car Thing certainly brings back that feeling with its construction.
All the adapters were connected to the body of the device using a very strong magnet, which prevented it from falling even when driving on dirt roads.
In addition to that, along its entire upper part you can find small buttons, which can be easily configured to activate different playlists or podcasts.
By long-pressing one of the buttons while listening, or by asking the voice assistant, I set some playlists that I listen to frequently and the radio program that I listen to every morning on the go.
In doing so, the feature made me feel like the Car Thing is more like a car radio than an extension of my smartphone.
From an old car to a smart car
After a fairly simple physical setup, I plugged the Car Thing in.
I was pleasantly surprised by the setup process.
The instructions were clear, connecting to the Spotify app took less than 5 minutes, and a few moments later I reached the home screen.
In fact, the device connects to the smartphone via Bluetooth and controls the application like a remote control, and therefore can copy all the information about our account from it.
Meaning, you will still have to connect your smartphone to the car, either via Bluetooth or via an AUX cable in order to hear the music.
The home screen is familiar to all users of the application, since like the smartphone application, it emphasizes the album images and playlists.
Also, on the home screen, like the one in the application, you can find music recommendations according to your taste, the search screen and your personal library.
As mentioned, you can navigate between the different screens using the touch screen or the manual dial.
Moreover, at any given moment, you can call the device's voice assistant by saying "Hey Spotify".
Using it, you can play songs, playlists, albums and even search for podcasts.
In my experience, it recognized my voice quite easily even when the music was playing in the background and the air conditioner was blowing directly on the device.
This is probably thanks to the four microphones installed in the upper part.
It is important to note that currently the voice assistant does not support Hebrew, and as of the time of publishing the article, there is no information on when such an update will arrive.
So is it worth waiting for?
My experience using the device was great, which is a positive surprise to me considering that it is still in an initial release stage.
Even with intensive use on long trips, the device continued to work smoothly without disconnecting from my smartphone.
Still, every now and then there is a small stutter in the interface, but I believe that Spotify will address such bugs with future version updates.

It is evident that the Swedish company has worked on it a lot in recent years, and of the various versions that have leaked online during this period, the design of the final product is probably my favorite.
Still, when I first saw the Car Thing, I wondered who exactly the company was trying to target it to.
After all, his activity amounts to controlling the application on the smartphone, and not much beyond that.
How is it different from buying a car stand for a few shekels and connecting it so that the smartphone is closer to us while driving?
This question is strengthened when considering that iPhone and Android devices are much more powerful than Spotify's, and in most cases will give the user much more functionality.
Despite all that, as I used Car Thing more and more, I realized how it can improve the driving experience.
Being able to see the Waze on my smartphone screen and control the music on a completely different screen is one I've come to appreciate in the last couple of weeks.
One question remains - will Spotify even launch the device to the general public?
And if so, will it also be launched here in our small country?
The Swedish company is not saying much at the moment.
It hasn't even shared how many testers for the device it's currently running around the world, and how many it plans to add in the limited launch in the United States.
The only thing we know for sure is the expected price of 79 dollars (about NIS 255).
Meanwhile, the Car Thing provides a first look at a concept that Spotify has been trying to crack for years.
Spotify Israel stated that there is currently no information about a plan to launch the device in Israel
Spotify wants to Upgrade your car: We tested the Car Thing
Quietly, Spotify has begun to try its luck in the hardware world, too. •
After years of development, Car Thing was unveiled and launched as a small experiment in the US •
We got our hands on the first device in Israel. •
Make your old cars smart
The Car Thing is Spotify's first hardware product and was built specifically to provide a solution for people with older vehicles.
A few weeks ago, I got an initial opportunity to try the new product, which is currently only available to individual experimenters in the US, here in Israel.
For me, the timing of the delivery was extraordinary, as our home car broke down and we had to drive for several days with a replacement vehicle with an old system.
After two weeks of toying, I realized how the car thing could easily become an integral part of many people's system.
On the other hand, with a long waiting list and uncertainty about a global launch, I believe many would already prefer to use other solutions.
From Idea to Reality

Somewhere in 2018, Spotify users started to get an interesting offer in their email box - the option to purchase a new device with voice control and fourth-generation connectivity, which would turn any old system into a smart car.

The rumours slowly fizzled out until a year later, when the Financial Times revealed that the company was soon planning to introduce a new car product that simulates a smart radio with Bluetooth connectivity.

A few months later, those rumors made headlines again after the music service was updated with the car mode - the same one we now know from the app - activated as soon as the smartphone detects a connection to the system in the car.
Two years have passed since then.
After countless rumors and leaks, Spotify last April unveiled "Car Thing," its smart vehicle system.
Spotify has chosen to release the new device in a very limited way, with a long waiting list and many delays when it comes to shipments.
So of course, right after the press conference that was held, I went to the website and signed up.
Two months later, the long-awaited announcement arrived.
Reconnecting to the site will give me the opportunity to purchase the device with a little surprise - it will cost me nothing.
After another month of waiting, the courier finally knocked on my door, accompanied by a small box with the Spotify logo on it.
The Car Thing
First and foremost, Spotify's device impressed me greatly with the quality of its construction.
And it's slightly smaller than my iPhone 11 and features a larger, brighter and sharper touchscreen than I expected.
You'll also find a round button and dial next to the screen that you can rotate to navigate between the interface screens.
And despite the huge dial, which you can see in the photos, the Car Thing manages to maintain a relatively slim profile and not stand out too much from the dashboard.
Personally, I would prefer that the company allow me to change the dial activity so that I can control the volume of the smartphone, as I can also navigate using the touch screen.
It might be possible in a future version update.
The device comes in a small, minimalist cardboard box, which includes, among other things, a USB Type-C cable and various adapters to install.
Many of you may remember how in the past we used to unplug radios and hide them in a drawer after getting out of the car.
The Car Thing certainly brings back that feeling with its construction form.
The adapters were attached to the body of the device using a magnet that was very strong, preventing it from falling even when driving on dirt roads.
In addition, along the entire top you can find small buttons, which can be easily configured to run different playlists or podcasts.
By long pressing one of the buttons while listening, or by asking the voice assistant, I defined how many playlists I hear frequently and the radio show I listen to every morning on the go.
In doing so, the feature made me feel that the Car Thing was more like a car radio than an extension of my smartphone.
From Old car to smart car
After a fairly simple physical installation, I plugged the Car Thing into electricity.
I was pleasantly surprised by the setting process.
The instructions were clear, connecting to the Spotify app took less than 5 minutes, and a few moments later I reached the home screen.
In fact, the device connects to the smartphone via Bluetooth and controls the app like a remote, so can copy all our account information from it.
This means you'll still have to connect your smartphone to the car, either via Bluetooth or via an AUX cable in order to hear the music.
The home screen is familiar to all app users, since like the app on a smartphone, it places an emphasis on album photos and playlists.
Also, on the home screen, like the one in the app, you can find music recommendations based on your tastes, your search screen and your personal library.
As mentioned above, you can navigate between the different screens using the touch screen or the manual dial.
Better yet, you can at any given moment call the device's voice assistant by saying "Hey Spotify."
Through it, you can play songs, playlists, albums and even search for podcasts.
From my experience she quite easily recognized my voice even when the music was playing in the background and the air conditioner blew directly onto the device.
This is probably due to the four microphones installed at the top.
It is important to note that at the moment the voice assistant does not support Hebrew, and as of the time of publication, there is no information on when such an update will arrive.
Is it worth waiting for?
My experience of using the device has been great, which is a positive surprise to me considering it is still in an initial release phase.
Even when used intensively on long trips, the device continued to work smoothly without disconnecting from my smartphone.
Still, occasionally a little stutter is recorded in the interface, but I believe Spotify will address such bugs with future version updates.

It's evident that the Swedish company has worked on it a lot in recent years, and of the various versions that have leaked online in this period, the design of the final product is probably my favorite.
Still, when I saw the Car Thing for the first time, I wondered who exactly the company was trying to designate it for.
After all, it comes down to controlling the app on a smartphone, and not much else.
What's different from buying a car stand for a few shekels and plugging it in so the smartphone is closer to us while driving?
That question is reinforced when you consider that iPhones and Android devices are much more powerful than Spotify's, and most of the time will buy the user a lot more functionality.
Even so, as I used Car Thing more and more, I realized how it could improve the driving experience.
Being able to see Waze on my smartphone screen and control music on a completely different screen is one I've learned to appreciate over the past two weeks.
One question remains - will Spotify even launch the device to the general public?
And if so, will it also be launched here in our small country?
The Swedish company is not saying much at the moment.
It hasn't even shared how many testers for the device it currently operates around the world, and how many it plans to add at its upcoming launch in the United States.
The only thing we know for sure is that the price is expected to be 79 dollars (about 255 shekels).
In the meantime, Car Thing provides an initial glimpse into a concept Spotify has been trying to crack for years.
Spotify Israel says it has no information at this time about a plan to launch the device in Israel

The Car Thing is Spotify's first hardware product, built specifically to provide a solution for people who own older cars.
A few weeks ago, I got an initial opportunity to try the new product, which is currently only available to individual experimenters in the US, here in Israel, and now in Israel.
For me, the timing of the delivery was outstanding, as our home car broke down and we had to drive for several days with a replacement vehicle with an old system.
After two weeks of playing around, I realized how the Car Thing could easily become an integral part of many people's systems.
On the other hand, with a long waiting list and uncertainty regarding a global launch, I believe that many will already prefer to use other solutions.
From idea to reality, it's from reality.

Somewhere in 2018, Spotify users began to receive an interesting offer in their email inbox the possibility of purchasing a new device with voice control and fourth-generation connectivity, which will make any old car system smart, making any old car system smart and smart.

The rumors slowly faded until a year later, when the Financial Times website revealed that the company plans to soon introduce a new car product that simulates a smart radio with Bluetooth connectivity.

A few months later, these rumors made headlines again after the music service updated with the vehicle mode - the same one we know today from the app - which is activated as soon as the smartphone detects a connection to the system in the car in the car.
Two years have passed since then.
After countless rumors and leaks, Spotify unveiled Car Thing, its smart car system, in April.
Spotify chose to release the new device in a very limited way, with a long waiting list and many delays when it comes to deliveries.
So of course, right after the press conference she held, I went to the website and signed up.
Two months later, the long-awaited announcement arrived.
Reconnecting to the site will give me the opportunity to purchase the device with a small surprise - it won't cost me anything.
After another month of waiting, the courier finally knocked on my door, accompanied by a small box with the Spotify logo on it.
The Car Thing is the one.
First and foremost, Spotify's device impressed me greatly with its build quality.
And it's slightly smaller than my iPhone 11 and has a big, bright and sharp touch screen on the front than I expected.
Also, you will find next to the screen a round button and a dial that you can rotate to navigate between the interface screens.
And despite the huge dial, which you can see in the pictures, the Car Thing manages to maintain a relatively thin profile and not stand out too much from the dashboard.
Personally, I would prefer the company to allow changing the activity of the dial so that I can control the volume of the smartphone, since I can also navigate using the touch screen.
Perhaps this will be possible in a future version update.
The device comes in a small, minimalist cardboard box, which includes, among other things, a USB Type C cable and various adapters for its installation.
Many of you probably remember how in the past we used to disconnect the radios and hide them in a drawer after leaving the car from the car.
The Car Thing undoubtedly brings that feeling back with its construction form.
All adapters were connected to the body of the device using a magnet that was very strong, which prevented it from falling even when driving on dirt roads.
On top of that, along the entire top you can find small buttons, which you can easily set up to play different playlists or podcasts.
By long pressing one of the buttons while listening, or by asking my voice assistant, I set up some playlists that I listen to frequently and the radio show that I listen to every morning on the go.
In doing so, the feature made me feel that the Car Thing is more like a car radio than an extension of my smartphone.
An old automobile for a smart car.
After a fairly simple physical setup, I plugged the Car Thing in.
I was pleasantly surprised by the setup process.
The instructions were clear, connecting to the Spotify app took less than 5 minutes, and a few moments later I reached the home screen.
In fact, the device connects to the smartphone via Bluetooth and controls the application like a remote control, and therefore can copy all the information about our account from it.
That means you'll still have to connect your smartphone to your car, either via Bluetooth or AUX cable in order to hear the music.
The home screen is familiar to all users of the application, since like the application on the smartphone, it emphasizes the photos of the albums and the playlists.
Also, on the home screen, like the one in the app, you can find music recommendations according to your taste, the search screen and your personal library.
As mentioned above, you can navigate between the different screens using the touch screen or using the manual dial.
Moreover, at any given moment, you can call the device's voice assistant by saying "Hey Spotify" by saying "Hey Spotify".
Using it, you can play songs, playlists, albums and even search for podcasts.
In my experience, she recognized my voice quite easily even when the music was playing in the background and the air conditioner blew directly on the device.
This is probably thanks to the four microphones installed at the top.
It is important to note that at the moment the voice assistant does not support Hebrew, and as of the time of publication of the article, there is no information on when such an update will arrive.
So, is it worth waiting for him?
My experience using the device has been great, which is a positive surprise to me given that it is still in the initial release phase.
Even in intensive use on long trips, the device continued to work smoothly without disconnecting from my smartphone.
Still, occasionally a small stutter is recorded in the interface, but I believe Spotify will address such bugs with future version updates.

It is evident that the Swedish company has worked on it a lot in recent years, and among the different versions that leaked online during this period, the design of the final product is probably my favorite.
Still, when I saw the Car Thing for the first time, I wondered to whom exactly the company was trying to designate it for.
After all, his activity amounts to controlling the application on a smartphone, and not much beyond that.
What is different from buying a car stand for a few shekels and connecting it so that the smartphone will be closer to us when driving.
This question is reinforced when considering that iPhones and Android devices are much more powerful than Spotify's, and in most cases will give the user much more functionality.
Despite all this, as I used Car Thing more and more, I realized how it could improve the driving experience.
Being able to see Waze on my smartphone screen and control music on a completely different screen is one I've come to appreciate over the past two weeks.
One question remains will Spotify even launch the device to the general public?
And if so, will it also be launched here in our small country?
The Swedish company doesn't say much at the moment.
It hasn't even shared how many experimenters for the device it currently operates around the world, and how much it plans to add in its limited launch in the United States.
The only thing we know for sure is the price that is expected to be 79 dollars ( about NIS 255) .
Meanwhile, the Car Thing provides an initial glimpse into a concept Spotify has been trying to crack for years.
Spotify Israel said there is currently no information about a plan to launch the device in Israel.
גייסתם טאלנט לחברה?
ככה תשמרו שהמתחרים לא "יחטפו" לכם אותו.
המשק עדיין נמצא בשוק עבודה שנשלט ברובו על ידי העובדים, והדבר נכון שבעתיים בכל הנוגע לעובדים הנחשקים ביותר - הטאלנטים •
להלן כמה עצות שיעזרו לכם לשמור עליו במקום העבודה
על אף העלייה שנרשמה בחודש האחרון, שיעור האבטלה בישראל ממשיך להיות מהנמוכים בעולם, ובעשירייה הראשונה מבין מדינות ה-OECD, עם שיעור של 3.5% (150.6 אלף מובטלים, על-פי הלמ"ס).
כלומר, המשק עדיין נמצא בשוק עבודה שנשלט ברובו על-ידי העובדים והדבר נכון שבעתיים בכל הנוגע לעובדים הנחשקים ביותר – הטאלנטים.
בכל הנוגע לאותם אנשי מקצוע ומנהלים המהווים מוקדי ידע, ניסיון ויכולת מוכחים – המגמות בשוק העבודה מלמדות כי התחרות עליהם, הטאלנטים כפי שהם מכונים על-ידי המעסיקים, עדיין קיימת במלוא הכוח.
המשמעות של זה עבור מעסיקים היא שבמצב שוק העבודה הנוכחי אין להם את הלוקסוס של לנוח על זרי הדפנה אפילו דקה לאחר גיוסו של טאלנט נחשק, שכן ברגע שהוא יכנס בשערי החברה – חברה אחרת כבר תנסה לחטוף אותו אליה.
כלומר, התחרות על הטאלנטים כה עזה שרבים שגם לאחר גיוסם הם ימשיכו לקבל שלל הצעות עבודה מפתות, כאשר 30% מהעובדים אכן עוזבים כחודש בלבד מקבלת המשרה ותחילת העבודה.
זו הסיבה שמעסיקים נבונים יעברו באופן מידי משלב גיוס הטאלנט לשלב השימור שלו, כאשר הדרך מתחיל בראש ובראשונה בהיערכות מראש ונקיטת יצירתיות כבר בתהליך הקליטה שלו.
תהליך קליטה יעיל, מובנה ומתחשב יגרום לטאלנט להתלהב ממקום העבודה החדש שלו כבר מהיום הראשון ואף לצפות לבאות.
להלן מספר עצות כיצד להיערך ולנהל תהליך קליטה נכון שיסייע בשימורו של הטאלנט החדש:
זה לא סוד - שיתוף ומוכנות הארגון |
שתפו את הגורמים שיעבדו איתו על גיוסו, הסבירו להם מדוע הוא חיוני וחשוב לחברה ולתפקיד, וכיצד אתם רואים את תרומתו.
עובד חדש שמגיע למקום בו מצפים לו ומבינים את ערכו, ירגיש רצוי וישאף להוכיח את הציפיות שתולים בן.
ידע הוא כוח - תיאום ציפיות |
כבר ביום הראשון ערכו עם הטאלנט שיחת תיאום ציפיות.
הכירו את הרקע המקצועי שלו ובדקו איפה הוא רואה את עצמו בעתיד, כדי שתוכלו להציג לו את הכלים המגוונים והייחודיים שאתם ומקום העבודה יכולים לספק לו כדי להגיע לשם.
כולנו אנשים – הכרות אישית |
במהלך ימי הקליטה נסו להכיר את הטאלנט מעבר לתכונותיו המקצועיות והתעניינו בתחביבים ובתחומי העניין שלו.
עובד חדש שמגלים בו עניין ומאפשרים לו לממש ולבטא את עצמו מעבר לגבולות תפקידו יעריך זאת וירצה לשמור על כך.
הסקרנות מקדמת |
כבר בשלב הקליטה אתם יכולים ליצור אטרקטיביות שתגרום לטאלנט לרצות להשתלב מהר.
עשו זאת לאו דווקא על-ידי שיח של בונוסים והטבות, אלא על-ידי חשיפתו לתחום מלהיב או לטכנולוגיה מעניינת, שכן גירויים מסוג זה ליצירתיות מובילים לסקרנות ולעניין גובר במקום העבודה.
כמו כן, עודדו את הטאלנט להשמיע את מחשבותיו ודעותיו לפרויקטים השונים בחברה והבהירו לו שהן חשובות לארגון.
הכותבת הינה מנכ"לית Manpower ישראל – חברת ההשמה וכוח האדם הגדולה בישראל
Did you recruit a talent for the company?
That’s how you’ll keep your competitors from "hijacking" them from you.
The economy is still in the labor market that is largely controlled by the workers, and this is more true for the most desirable workers—the talents •
Here are some tips to help you keep the talent working for the company

Despite the increase registered in the last month, the unemployment rate in Israel continues to be one of the lowest in the world, and in the top ten among the OECD countries, with a rate of 3.5% (150.6 thousand unemployed, according to the CBS).
Meaning, the economy is still in the labor market that is largely controlled by the workers, and this is more true for the most desirable workers—the talents.

As far as those professionals and managers, the centers of proven knowledge, experience and ability, are concerned—the trends in the labor market show that the competition for the talents—as they are named by the employers, is still on.

The meaning of this for employers is that in the current state of the labor market, they do not have the luxury of resting on their laurels even a minute after the recruitment of a desirable talent, because as soon as they enter the company’s gates—another company will already try to kidnap them.

In other words, the competition for talent is so intense that many, even after being hired, will continue to receive a handful of tempting job offers, when 30% of employees actually leave only a month after accepting the position and starting work.

This is the reason why wise employers will immediately move from the phase of recruiting talent to the phase of retaining it, this begins first and foremost with preparation in advance and being creative early during the process of integration.
An efficient, structured and thoughtful integration process will make the talent enthusiastic about his/her new workplace from the very first day and even look forward to the future.
Here are some tips on how to prepare and manage a correct integration process that will help in retaining the new talent:
It’s not a secret—sharing and organization’s readiness |
Share the factors that will work with them on their recruitment, explain to them why they are essential and important to the company and the position, and how you see their contribution.
A new employee who arrives at a place where he is expected and understands his/her value, will feel welcome and strive to prove the expectations placed on him/her.
Knowledge is power—coordination of expectations |
Already on the first day, have a meeting with the talent to coordinate expectations.

Get to know their professional background and check where they see themselves in the future, so that you can show them the diverse and unique tools that you and the workplace can provide them to get there.
We are all people—personal acquaintance |
During the days of integration, try to get to know the talent beyond their professional qualities and take an interest in their hobbies and interests.
A new employee who is a focus of interest and is allowed to fulfil and express himself beyond the limits of his role will appreciate it and want to keep it.
Curiosity promotes |
within the integration phase you can create an appeal that will cause the talent to wish to integrate quickly.

Do this not necessarily by talking about bonuses and benefits, but by showing him an exciting field or an interesting technology, since this kind of stimulation for creativity leads to curiosity and increasing interest in the workplace.
In addition, encourage the talent to voice their thoughts and opinions on various projects in the company and make it clear to them that they are important to the organization.
The author is the CEO of Manpower Israel—the largest placement and manpower company in Israel

Also, they encouraged the talent to voice his thoughts and opinions on the various projects in the company, making it clear that they are important to the organization.
The author is the CEO of Manpower Israel - the largest recruitment and human resources company in Israel.

An efficient, structured and thoughtful recruitment process will make the talent excited about their new workplace from day one and even look forward to the future.
Here are some tips on how to set up and run a proper hiring process to help retain new talent:
It's not a secret -- sharing and organizing.
Share the factors that will work with him on his recruitment, explain to them why he's vital and important to the company and the role, and how you see his contribution.
A new employee who arrives where he is expected and understands his value will feel wanted and will strive to prove his expected.
Knowledge is power -- align expectations.
On the first day, they had a talent coordination expectation call.

Get to know his professional background and find out where he sees himself in the future, so that you can show him the diverse and unique tools that you and the workplace can provide him to get there.
We are all people -- personal acquaintances.
During the recording days we tried to get to know the talent beyond his professional qualities and were interested in his hobbies and interests.
A new employee who is interested and allowed to express himself beyond the confines of his job will appreciate that and want to keep it that way.
Curiosity comes first.
Even at the intake stage, you can create an attraction that will make the talent want to fit in quickly.

And do it not by talking about bonuses and perks, but by exposing him to an exciting field or an interesting technology, because that kind of stimulation of creativity leads to curiosity and increased interest in the workplace.
Also, encourage talent to voice their thoughts and opinions about the various projects in the company and make it clear that they are important to the organization.
The writer is the CEO of Manpower Israel Israel's largest human resources and inspiration company

חשמול בכיס: עלות אי־סגירת התחנות הפחמיות ביוני - מיליארד שקלים
דו"ח של מרכז המחקר והמידע של הכנסת: אי־סגירת התחנות הפחמיות במועד שנקבע ביוני 2022 מוערכת בכמיליארד שקלים
• חברת החשמל: "מדיניות השימוש בדלקים מוכתבת בראש ובראשונה על ידי משרד האנרגיה"
העלות הכלכלית בגין אי־סגירת התחנות הפחמיות במועד שנקבע ביוני 2022 מוערכת בכמיליארד שקלים עבור שנת 2022, כך חושף דו"ח של מרכז המחקר והמידע של הכנסת.
לפי הדו"ח, עלות זו מגולמת בתעריף החשמל לצרכן, שכאמור צפוי לעלות בחודשים הקרובים בגלל התייקרות הפחם.

נוסף על כך, ב־2023 צפויה כמות עודפת נוספת של שימוש בפחם של כ־900 אלף טונות, כך שהדבר יתבטא בעלות נוספת למשק החשמל בגין אי־סגירת התחנות הפחמיות, בהנחה שמחיר הגז הטבעי יישאר נמוך משמעותית ביחס למחיר הפחם.
בדו"ח נכתב כי המשמעות של הפחתת כמיליארד שקלים בתעריף החשמל ב־2022 היתה הפחתה של כ־4% בתעריף צריכת החשמל לצרכן הביתי.
כלומר, העלות הכלכלית של אי־סגירת התחנות היא כמיליארד שקלים, וסך ההוזלה שהיתה יכולה להיות לצרכן הביתי היא כ־4%.
יש לציין כי במסגרת הרפורמה במשק החשמל הוחלט בין היתר על הקמת חברה־בת של חברת החשמל, אשר תקים יחידות המופעלות בגז טבעי, שנועדו להחליף את היחידות הפחמיות 4-1 באתר אורות רבין.
בהמשך להחלטה זו התקבלה החלטת ממשלה ביולי 2018, הקובעת כי יש להפסיק את פעילותן של יחידות הייצור הפחמיות 4-1 בתחנת הכוח אורות רבין.
בהחלטה נקבעו לוחות זמנים, כך שהקמת היחידה הראשונה בגז טבעי תחל בינואר 2020 והפעלתה תחל ביוני 2022, ובהתאם לכך גם יחידות הייצור הפחמיות 4-1 יפסיקו לפעול במועד זה.
מחברת החשמל נמסר בתגובה: "מדיניות השימוש בדלקים מוכתבת בראש ובראשונה על ידי משרד האנרגיה.
בהתאם להחלטות המשרד, מיושמת בישראל זה כמה שנים מדיניות של צמצום השימוש בפחם למינימום האפשרי גם כאשר מחיר הפחם נמוך ממחיר הגז".
Electrification is in your pocket: the cost of keeping the coal-based power stations open in June—one billion NIS
The Knesset’s Research and Information Center reports: The failure to shut down the coal-based power stations by the date set in June 2022, is estimated at about one billion NIS
• The Electricity Company: "The fuel usage policy is dictated first and foremost by the Ministry of Energy"

The economic cost of not closing the coal-based power stations by the date set in June 2022 is estimated at about one billion NIS for the year 2022, according to a report by the Knesset’s Research and Information Center.
According to the report, this cost is inclusive in the consumer’s electricity tariff, which as mentioned, is expected to increase in the coming months due to the increase in the price of coal.

In addition, during 2023 an additional excess amount of coal use of approximately 900 thousand tons is expected, consequently, an additional cost to the electricity sector for not closing the coal power stations is deemed necessary, assuming that the price of natural gas shall remain significantly lower than the price of coal.
The report states that reducing approximately one billion NIS of the electricity tariff in 2022, lead to a reduction of approximately 4% in the electricity consumption tariff for the home consumer.
That is, the economic cost of not closing the stations is about a billion NIS, and the total discount that could have been granted to the home consumer is about 4%.

It should be noted that as part of the reform in the electricity sector, it was decided to establish a subsidiary of the Electric Company, which will build natural gas powered units intended to substitute the coal-fired units 1–4 at the Orot Rabin site.
Further to this decision, a government decision was made in July 2018, stating that the activity of the coal-fired production units 1–4 at the Orot Rabin power plant must be stopped.

According to time-lines established as part of the decision, the construction of the first natural gas unit will begin in January 2020 and will be fully operational in June 2022, consequently the coal-fired production units 1–4 will cease to operate at the same time.
The electricity company responded: "The fuel usage policy is dictated first and foremost by the Ministry of Energy.

According to the ministry’s decisions, a policy of reducing the use of coal to the minimum possible has been implemented in Israel for several years, even when the price of coal is lower than the price of gas".
Electricity in the pocket: The cost of not closing the coal plants in June - one billion shekels.
A report from the Knesset's Research and Information Center: The estimated cost of not closing the coal stations by the set date in June 2022 is about one billion shekels.
The Electric Company: "The policy of fuel usage is primarily dictated by the Ministry of Energy."

The economic cost of not closing the coal stations by the set date in June 2022 is estimated at about one billion shekels for the year 2022, as revealed by a report from the Research and Information Center of the Knesset.
According to the report, this cost is reflected in the electricity tariff for consumers, which is expected to rise in the coming months due to the increase in coal prices.

In addition, in 2023, there is expected to be an additional surplus of about 900,000 tons of coal usage, which will result in additional costs to the electricity market due to the non-closure of coal plants, assuming that the price of natural gas will remain significantly lower than the price of coal.
The report stated that a reduction of about one billion shekels in the electricity tariff in 2022 would mean a reduction of about 4% in the electricity consumption tariff for the domestic consumer.
In other words, the economic cost of not closing the stations is about a billion shekels, and the total discount that could have been for the domestic consumer is about 4%.

It should be noted that as part of the electricity market reform, among other things, it was decided to establish a subsidiary of the Electric Company, which will build units powered by natural gas, intended to replace coal units 1-4 at the Orot Rabin site.
Following this decision, a government resolution was adopted in July 2018, stating that the operation of coal production units 1-4 at the Orot Rabin power station should be ceased.

The decision set timelines, so the construction of the first natural gas unit will begin in January 2020 and its operation will start in June 2022, and accordingly, the coal production units 1-4 will also cease to operate at this time.
The Electric Company responded: "The policy of fuel usage is primarily dictated by the Ministry of Energy.

In accordance with the ministry's decisions, a policy of minimizing the use of coal to the lowest possible level has been implemented in Israel for several years, even when the price of coal is lower than the price of gas.

משלמים את המחיר: כל מה שצריך לדעת לקראת עליית הריבית
גזירות ללא הרף: בשבוע הבא הריבית על השקל צפויה לעלות בחצי אחוז •
בכמה יתייקר התשלום על המשכנתא?
ומה מומלץ לעשות? •
כל התשובות
האינפלציה המחריפה בישראל, שכבר הגיעה לקצב של יותר מ־4% בשנה האחרונה, תאלץ את בנק ישראל להעלות את הריבית על השקל כבר בשבוע הבא.
הערכות האנליסטים מדברות על שיעור העלאה שנע בין 0.25% ל־0.5%.
אם אכן תעלה הריבית בשיעור של חצי אחוז, היא תעמוד כבר על 1.25%, הרמה הגבוהה זה תשע שנים.
זאת, לאחר שבמשך שנים הריבית במשק היתה קרובה לאפס.
העלייה החדה בשיעור הריבית מייקרת במאות שקלים את החזרי המשכנתאות ומכבידה בצורה דרסטית על משקי הבית.
בעזרת שי צרור, מומחה למשכנתאות, בדקנו כמה נשלם יותר ומה מומלץ לעשות כבר עכשיו.
אם הריבית תעלה בחצי אחוז - בכמה יתייקר התשלום החודשי על המשכנתא?
במשכנתא בסכום של 1.2 מיליון שקל, שמורכבת מ־40% מסלול ריבית פריים, ההחזר החודשי יעלה ב־125 שקלים.
בכמה התייקרה המשכנתא הממוצעת מתחילת השנה?
מתחילת השנה מדובר בעלייה חדה יותר באופן משמעותי.
זאת, משום שגם הריביות ביתר המסלולים שמרכיבים משכנתא (ולא רק במסלול פריים) עלו - במסלול צמוד מדד ובמסלול הריבית הקבועה.
אם הריבית אכן תעלה בחצי אחוז, ההתייקרות תסתכם, לפי הערכתו של צרור, בכ־620 שקלים במשכנתא של כ־1.2 מיליון שקלים.
מסלול הפריים (40% במסלול הזה) ישלים התייקרות של כ־280 שקלים, בהנחה שתהיה עלייה של עוד 0.5% בחודש הבא.
מסלול הריבית המשתנה צמודת מדד (26.7% במסלול הזה) ישלים התייקרות של כ־120 שקלים.
מסלול הריבית הקבועה - לא צמוד מדד (33.3% במסלול הזה) יתייקר ב־220 שקלים.
אז מה מומלץ לעשות כיום?
עבור מי שיש להם משכנתא שרובה צמוד למדד, צרור ממליץ לשקול מיחזור למסלולים שאינם צמודים.
לנוטלי משכנתאות שההחזר החודשי עלה מבחינתם בצורה משמעותית וקשה להם לעמוד בהחזרים - הוא ממליץ לבחון לבצע מיחזור משכנתא ולפרוס אותה מחדש לתקופה ארוכה יותר.
זאת, כדי להפחית את התשלומים למרות העלייה בריבית, שכן עדיף תמיד לעמוד בהחזרים ולא להיות בחדלות פירעון.
לגבי נוטלי משכנתאות חדשים - הוא ממליץ מאוד להכיר את המסלולים השונים ולהתאים את המשכנתא ליכולותיהם הכלכליות.
כך גם בעתיד כשהריביות יירדו הם יוכלו לעשות מיחזור משכנתא עם מינימום עמלות פירעון מוקדם.
לגבי רוכשי דירות מקבלן - צרור ממליץ להקדים תשלומים לקבלן ולקחת משכנתא כעת.
יש להביא בחשבון כי "מדד תשומות הבנייה" מעלה את מחיר הנכס באופן משמעותי גם לאחר שנחתם חוזה הרכישה.
מדד מחירי תשומות הבנייה למגורים עלה בשנה האחרונה ב־6.6%.
על רקע ההתייקרות במדד זה, שלשום הודיע הפיקוח על הבנקים כי הוא שוקל לחייב יצירת מנגנון שיאפשר לכלול את ההצמדות בתוך המשכנתאות, אולם ההחלטה הסופית בנושא טרם התקבלה.
Paying the price: everything you need to know ahead of the interest rate hike
Constant decrees: next week the interest rate on the NIS is expected to increase by half a percent •
How much more expensive will the mortgage payment be?
And what is recommended to do? •
all the answers
The worsening inflation in Israel, which has already reached a rate of more than 4% in the past year, will force the Bank of Israel to raise the interest rate on the NIS as early as next week.
The analysts’ estimates mention an increase rate ranging from 0.25% to 0.5%.
If the interest rate does rise by half a percent, it will already stand at 1.25%, the highest level in nine years.
This rise, after the interest rate in the economy has been registered as close to zero for years.
The sharp increase in the interest rate increases the mortgage repayments by hundreds of NIS and drastically burdens the households.
With the help of Shai Zror, a mortgage expert, we checked how much more we will pay and what is recommended to do right now.
If the interest rate increases by half a percent—how much more expensive will the monthly payment on the mortgage be?
For a mortgage in the amount of 1.2 million NIS, which consists of a 40% prime interest plan, the monthly repayment will increase by 125 NIS.
By how much has the average mortgage become more expensive since the beginning of this year?
Since the beginning of the year, there has been a significantly sharper increase.
This is due to the interest rates have also gone up on the other plans that comprise a mortgage (and not just the prime track)—of the index-linked track and the fixed interest plan.
If the interest rate does go up by half a percent, the increase in price will amount, according to Zror’s estimate, to about 620 NIS on a mortgage of about 1.2 million NIS.
The prime route (40% in this route) will complete a price increase of about 280 NIS, assuming there will be another 0.5% increase next month.
The index-linked variable interest rate (26.7% on this rate) will add up to a price increase of about 120 NIS.
The index-linked variable interest rate (33.3% on this rate) will add up to a price increase of about 220 NIS.
So what is recommended to do today?
For those who have an mostly index-linked mortgage, Zror recommends considering recycling to routes that are not index-linked.

For mortgage holders whose monthly repayments have increased significantly and it is difficult for them to meet the repayments—he recommends looking into recycling a mortgage and redeploying it for a longer period.
This may be done to reduce payments despite the increase in interest, since it is always better to meet the repayments and not be insolvent.
Regarding new mortgage takers—he strongly recommends getting to know the different plans and adapting the mortgage to their financial abilities.
This way in the future, when interest rates drop, they will be able to recycle a mortgage with minimal early repayment fees.
Regarding apartment purchasers from a contractor—Zror recommends to make early payments to the contractor in advance and to take out a mortgage now.
It should be taken into account that the "construction input index" raises the price of the property significantly even after the purchase contract has been signed.
The price index of residential construction inputs increased by 6.6% in the last year.

considering the price increase of this index, on the day before yesterday the bank supervision authority announced that it is considering ordering the creation of a plan that would allow to include index linked within the mortgages, but the final decision on the issue has not yet been made.
Paying the price: Everything you need to know ahead of the interest rate hike.
Continuous cuts: Next week, the interest rate on the shekel is expected to rise by half a percent.
How much will the mortgage payment increase?
And what is recommended to do? •
All the answers.
The sharp inflation in Israel, which has already reached a rate of over 4% in the last year, will force the Bank of Israel to raise the interest rate on the shekel as early as next week.
The analysts' estimates talk about an increase rate ranging between 0.25% to 0.5%.
If indeed the interest rate increases by half a percent, it will already stand at 1.25%, the highest level in nine years.
This, after for years the interest rate in the economy was close to zero.
The sharp increase in the interest rate significantly raises the mortgage repayments by hundreds of shekels and drastically burdens the household economy.
With the help of Shai Tzror, a mortgage expert, we checked how much more we will pay and what is recommended to do right now.
If the interest rate increases by half a percent - how much will the monthly mortgage payment increase?
In a mortgage of 1.2 million shekels, composed of 40% prime interest rate, the monthly repayment will increase by 125 shekels.
How much has the average mortgage increased since the beginning of the year?
Since the beginning of the year, there has been a significantly sharper increase.
This is because the interest rates in the other mortgage components (not just in the prime track) have also increased - in the index-linked track and in the fixed interest rate track.
If the interest rate indeed rises by half a percent, the increase will amount to about 620 shekels, according to Tzror's estimate, on a mortgage of about 1.2 million shekels.
The Prime track (40% in this track) will complete an increase of about 280 shekels, assuming there will be another 0.5% increase next month.
The variable interest rate track linked to the index (26.7% in this track) will complete an increase of about 120 shekels.
The fixed interest rate track - not linked to the index (33.3% in this track) will increase by 220 shekels.
So what is recommended to do today?
For those who have a mortgage that is mostly linked to the index, Tsror recommends considering recycling to non-linked tracks.

For those with mortgages who find their monthly repayments have significantly increased and are struggling to meet them - he recommends considering a mortgage recycling and spreading it over a longer period.
This is to reduce the payments despite the interest rate increase, as it is always better to meet the repayments and not to be in default.
Regarding new mortgage borrowers - he highly recommends getting to know the different paths and adjusting the mortgage to their economic capabilities.
In the future, when the interest rates drop, they will be able to refinance their mortgage with minimal early repayment fees.
Regarding those who purchase apartments from a contractor - Tzror recommends making payments to the contractor in advance and taking a mortgage now.
It should be taken into account that the "construction inputs index" significantly increases the property price even after the purchase contract has been signed.
The residential construction cost index has risen by 6.6% in the last year.

In light of the increase in this index, the Banking Supervision recently announced that it is considering requiring the inclusion of indexation within mortgages, however, the final decision on the matter has not yet been made.

The index-linked variable interest rate track (26.7% on this track) will complement an increase of about NIS 120.
The fixed-rate track - not index-linked (33.3% on this track) will increase by 220 NIS.
So what is recommended to do nowadays?
For those with a largely index-linked mortgage, a bundle recommends considering recycling for non-indexed routes.
Mortgage takers whose monthly repayments have risen significantly and find it difficult to meet repayments, he recommends refinancing.
This is to reduce payments despite rising interest rates, as it is always better to meet repayments and not be insolvent.
As for new mortgage takers - he highly recommends getting to know the different routes and adjusting the mortgage to their financial capacities.
Same in the future when rates drop they will be able to do mortgage refinancing with minimum repayment fees early.
As for buyers of apartments from a contractor - a bundle recommends pre-empting payments to the contractor and taking out a mortgage now.
Keep in mind that the "building inputs index" increases the property price significantly even after the purchase contract is signed.
The price index for residential construction inputs increased by 6.6% over the past year.
The Banking Supervision Department announced yesterday that it is considering creating a mechanism to include the mortgage.
Paying the Price: Everything you need to know about rising interest rates
Next week, the interest rate on the shekel is expected to rise by half a percent
How expensive is the mortgage payment?
What's recommended to do?
All the Answers
Increasing inflation in Israel, which has already reached a rate of more than 4 percent in the past year, will force the Bank of Israel to raise the interest rate on the shekel as early as next week.
Analysts estimate an increase of 0.25% to 0.5%.
If the interest rate rises by half a percent, it will already be 1.25 percent, the highest level in nine years.
For years, interest rates in the economy were close to zero.
The sharp increase in the interest rate increases mortgage repayments by hundreds of shekels and drastically burdens households.
With the help of Shai Tzaror, a mortgage expert, we checked how much more we would pay and what is recommended to do now.
If the interest rate increases by half a percent, how much will the monthly payment on the mortgage be expensive?
In a NIS 1.2 million mortgage, consisting of 40% prime interest rate, the monthly repayment will increase by NIS 125.
How much is the average mortgage rate this year?
Since the beginning of the year, this has been significantly higher.
This is because the interest rates in the other tracks that make up a mortgage (and not only in the prime track) also increased - in the index-linked track and in the fixed-rate track.
If the interest rate does indeed rise by half a percent, the increase will amount, according to Tsror's estimate, to about NIS 620 in a mortgage of about NIS 1.2 million.
The prime track (40% on this track) will increase by about NIS 280, assuming there will be another 0.5% increase next month.
The CPI-linked variable interest rate track (26.7% in this track) will complement an increase of NIS 120.
The fixed-interest track - not index-linked (33.3% in this track) will increase by NIS 220.
So what is recommended to do today?
For those who have a mortgage that is mostly index-linked, Tzrur recommends considering recycling to tracks that are not indexed.

Mortgage takers whose monthly repayments have increased significantly and find it difficult to meet their repayments - he recommends examining mortgage refinancing and redeploying it for a longer period.
This is to reduce payments despite the increase in interest, since it is better to always meet the repayments and not be in default.
As for new mortgage takers - he strongly recommends getting to know the different routes and adapting the mortgage to their economic capabilities.
The same is true in the future, when interest rates fall, they will be able to refinance with a minimum of early repayment fees.
As for apartment buyers from a contractor - Tsror recommends to advance payments to the contractor and take out a mortgage now.
It should be taken into account that the "construction inputs index" raises the price of the property significantly even after the purchase contract has been signed.
The price index of residential construction inputs increased by 6.6 percent last year.

Against the background of the increase in this index, the Banking Supervision Department announced yesterday that it is considering creating a mechanism that will enable the inclusion of bonds in mortgages, but the final decision on the matter has not yet been made.

מחיר הדלק מתייקר - והישראלים יאלצו לשלם ביולי יותר מ-8 שקלים לליטר
משרד האנרגיה הודיע כי המחיר החדש לליטר בנזין 95 אוקטן, יעמוד על 8.08 שקל •
במקביל, תוארך עד סוף 2022 ההפחתה של חצי ש"ח לליטר במס על הסולר
שיא של עשור: מחיר הבנזין יזנק ב-36 אגורות לליטר - ויעמוד החל מ-1 ביולי על יותר מ-8 שקלים לליטר.
המחיר החדש לליטר בנזין 95 אוקטן, יעמוד על-8.08 ומי שיבקש להינות משירות מלא, יידרש לשלם עוד 21 אגורות לליטר.
במקביל, תוארך ההפחתה של חצי שקל לליטר במס הסולר עד סוף 2022 - כך נמסר מרשות המסים.
כאמור, עליית המחיר נובעת מהמשך עליית מחירי הנפט, על רקע המלחמה בין רוסיה לאוקראינה ועליית שער הדולר.
אלמלא ההנחה של חצי שקל שמסבסדת הממשלה מאז חודש אפריל, מחיר הדלק היה עובר את שיא כל הזמנים - 8.25 שקלים לליטר.
תוקף ההנחה מסתיים בסוף יולי וברשות המסים ובאוצר מקדמים בימים אלה פרסום להערות הציבור של צו המאריך את ההפחתה במס על הבנזין, העומדת על חצי שקל לליטר, עד ל-9 באוגוסט.
כמו כן, החל מ-10 באוגוסט, תיקבע הפחתה נוספת של עוד חצי שקל, כך שרק ממועד זה מחירו של ליטר בנזין יפחת בשקל אחד וזאת עד ל-15 בנובמבר 2022.
כך נמסר מרשות המסים.
"הגענו למצב שבו אני לא זוכר חמישה חודשים ברצף של עודף בהכנסות המדינה.
התחלנו לפני כמה חודשים עם נושא הפחתת המס על הסולר.
אנחנו כבר שבוע עובדים על הארכה בעוד ארבעה חודשים של מס הבלו, הבנזין והסולר - במקום חצי שקל לשקל.
זה טוב לתעשייה ולאזרח.
אם נוריד, זה ישפיע על האינפלציה, יוזיל את הייצור ויקל את יוקר המחיה.
כשר האוצר, למרות מערכת הבחירות, אני מתכוון להתמקד קודם כל בזה", אמר השר ליברמן בכנס הורביץ לכלכלה וחברה של המכון הישראלי לדמוקרטיה.
נכון להיום, יותר ממחצית ממחיר הדלק היא המסים שגובה הממשלה (מס בלו ומע"מ) - ומדובר בשיעור מיסוי גבוה בהשוואה למרבית המדינות המפותחות.
למחיר הדלק יש השפעה דרמטית על יוקר המחיה במשק - משום שהוא משפיע גם על הוצאות משקי הבית וגם על הוצאות העסקים, על מחירי התחבורה הציבורית והטיסות, על עלויות ההובלה ועוד.
Fuel price is rising—and Israelis will have to pay more than 8 NIS per liter in July
The Ministry of Energy announced that the new price per liter of 95 octane gasoline will be 8.08 NIS •
At the same time, the reduction of 0.5 NIS per liter in the diesel tax will be extended to the end of 2022
A record of a decade: the price of gasoline will jump by 36 agorot per liter—and will be more than 8 NIS per liter as of July 1.
The new price per liter of 95 octane gasoline will be 8.08 NIS and those who wish to enjoy full service, will be requested to pay an extra 21 agorot per liter.
At the same time, the reduction of 0.5 NIS per liter in the diesel fuel tax will be extended until the end of 2022—the Tax Authority said.
As mentioned, the price increase is due to the continuous rise in oil prices, the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine and the increase of the dollar exchange rate.
If it weren’t for the half-shekel discount that the government has been subsidizing since April, the price of fuel would have exceeded the all-time high—8.25 shekels per liter.

The discount expires at the end of July and the Tax Authority and Treasury are currently promoting the publication for public comments upon a decree to extend the tax reduction on gasoline, which is 0.5 NIS per liter, to August 9.
Also, starting on August 10, another reduction of 0.5 NIS will be implemented, so that from this date the gasoline price per liter will be reduced by 1.0 NIS until November 15, 2022.
As was reported by the Tax Authority.
"We have reached a situation where I don’t remember having had excesses in state revenues, five consecutive months.
We started a few months ago to apply the issue of reducing the tax on diesel.
We have been working for a week on the extension of the excise, gasoline and diesel tax by four months—instead of 0.5 NIS to 1 NIS.
This is beneficiary for the industry as well as for the citizen.
If we lower it, it will impact inflation, lower production costs and lower the cost of living.
As the Minister of Finance, despite the election campaign, I intend to focus on this first", said Minister Lieberman at the Israel Democracy Institute’s Horvitz Conference on Economy and Society.
As of today, more than half of the price of fuel is the taxes collected by the government (excise tax and VAT)—and this is a high taxation rate compared to most developed countries.

The price of fuel has a dramatic effect on the cost of living in the economy—because it affects both household expenses and business expenses, as well as public transportation and flights prices, transport costs, and more.
