If we lower, it will affect inflation, lower production and lower the cost of living.
As Minister of Finance, despite the election campaign, I intend to focus on this first," said Minister Lieberman at the Israel Democracy Institute's Horvitz Conference on Economy and Society.
As of today, more than half of the price of fuel is the taxes collected by the government (excise tax and VAT) - and this is a high rate of taxation compared to most developed countries.

The price of fuel has a dramatic effect on the cost of living in the economy - because it affects both household expenses and business expenses, the prices of public transportation and flights, transportation costs, and more.
The price of fuel is rising - and Israelis will have to pay more than NIS 8 per liter in July
The Ministry of Energy announced that the new price for a liter of gasoline, 95 octane, will be 8.08 NIS •
At the same time, by the end of 2022, the reduction of half NIS per liter in the tax on diesel will be extended
A decade high: The price of gasoline will jump by 36 cents per liter-and will stand at more than 8 shekels per liter from July 1.
The new price for a 95-octane liter of gasoline will be 8.08 and those who wish to enjoy full service will be required to pay an additional 21 cents per liter.
At the same time, the reduction of half shekel per liter in the diesel tax will be extended until the end of 2022, according to the Tax Authority.
As mentioned above, the price increase is due to the continued rise in oil prices, against the backdrop of the war between Russia and Ukraine and the rise of the dollar.
Were it not for the half - shekel discount subsidized by the government since April, the price of gasoline would have passed the all-time high-NIS 8.25 per liter.

The discount expires at the end of July, and the Tax Authority and the Treasury are currently promoting publication for public comments of an order extending the reduction in the tax on gasoline, which stands at half a shekel per liter, until August 9.

In addition, from August 10, an additional reduction of another half shekel will be determined, so that only from this date will the price of a liter of gasoline be reduced by one shekel until November 15, 2022.
This is reported by the Tax Authority.
"We have reached a point where I can't remember five months in a row of excess state revenues.
We started a few months ago with the issue of reducing the tax on diesel.
We've been working for a week on a four - month extension of the excise, petrol and diesel tax-instead of half a shekel.
It's good for the industry and the citizen.
If we cut it, it would affect inflation, reduce production and ease the cost of living.
As finance minister, despite the election campaign, I intend to focus first of all on this," Lieberman told the Israel Democracy Institute's Horowitz Conference on Economics and Society.
At present, more than half of the price of fuel is the taxes collected by the government (excise tax and VAT) - and this is a high tax rate compared to most developed countries.

The price of fuel has a dramatic effect on the cost of living in the economy - because it affects both household and business expenses, public transport and air travel prices, transportation costs and more.

בפעם השלישית ברצף: אשדוד - העיר הידידות ביותר לעסקים
פתח תקווה הגיעה למקום השני בדירוג עשיית העסקים של משרד הכלכלה •
אחריהן: רחובות, אשקלון וראשון לציון •
השרה ברביבאי: "הקורונה הדגישה את חשיבות השלטון המקומי בפיתוח עסקים"
אשדוד היא העיר הידידותית ביותר לעסקים קטנים ובינוניים.
זו השנה השלישית ברציפות - כך מצא מדד עשיית עסקים ברשויות המקומיות של הסוכנות לעסקים קטנים ובינוניים במשרד הכלכלה והתעשייה, אשר דירג את הרשויות המקומיות.
במקום השני ממוקמת העיר פתח תקווה ובמקום השלישי רחובות.
אחריהן ממוקמות לפי הסדר: אשקלון, ראשון לציון, תל אביב־יפו, חיפה, רמת גן, חולון, באר שבע, ירושלים, בת ים, נתניה ובני ברק.
הסוכנות עורכת את מדד הרשויות המקומיות.
זו הפעם החמישית ומטרתו לשמש כלי עבודה עבור הרשות המקומית, שכן הוא מאפשר לכל רשות להשוות את ביצועיה לרשויות אחרות במגוון פרמטרים, וכן לנתח את ביצועיה בתחומים שבהם היא פעילה.
המדד מתבסס על כמה פרמטרים שנבחנים בכל רשות, אשר בוחנים את רמת ה"ידידותיות" של הרשות לעסקים המצויים בתחומה.
המדד מחלק את הרשויות לשלוש קבוצות גודל לפי מספר תושבים, שכן רשות מקומית של עד 50 אלף תושבים אינה דומה לרשות מקומית של יותר מ־150 אלף תושבים.
ת"א זינקה השנה
המדד מתעדכן אחת לשנה ומשקלל ארבעה דירוגים שונים בכל רשות מקומית: שביעות רצון של עסקים, נגישות למכרזים, נגישות המידע וארנונה.
מהדירוג עולה כי רמת גן ירדה מהמקום השני למקום השמיני, בת ים ירדה מהמקום הרביעי למקום ה־12 ונתניה ירדה מהמקום החמישי למקום ה־13.

ירידה בדירוג אינה אומרת שהשירות לעסקים של הרשות הידרדר, ובמקרים רבים היא נובעת מכך שהשירות של רשויות אחרות לעסקים השתפר יותר והן עלו בדירוג, בשעה שהרשות שירדה בדירוג שיפרה פחות את השירותים שלה לעסקים.
בין העולים בדירוג ניתן למצוא את פתח תקווה, שעלתה מהמקום השישי למקום השני, ורחובות שעלתה מהמקום ה־12 למקום השלישי.
תל אביב, שירדה ב־2019 מהמקום הרביעי למקום ה־11, השתפרה ב־2021 ועלתה למקום השישי.
"העסקים - מנוע צמיחה"
מהדירוג עולה כי נוף הגליל מובילה ברשויות המקומיות הכוללות בין 50 ל־150 אלף תושבים.
לאחריה ממוקמות קריית מוצקין, מטה בנימין, מודיעין־מכבים־רעות, כפר סבא, רעננה, נהריה, כרמיאל, עפולה והוד השרון.
במקום ה־28 והאחרון ממוקמת טבריה.
"המדד נועד לעודד רשויות מקומיות להקל על העסקים הקטנים והבינוניים, החל ממועד פתיחת העסק ולאורך פעילותו מול הרשויות", אומרת שרת הכלכלה והתעשייה, אורנה ברביבאי.
"העסקים מהווים מנוע צמיחה משמעותי למשק הישראלי והם אחראים לכ־50% מהתוצר העסקי ולכ־60% מהמועסקים במשק.
פיתוח העסקים הקטנים הוא אינטרס ציבורי של כולנו, אולם לרשות המקומית יש השפעה ישירה על העסקים שנמצאים בה.
הקורונה הדגישה את חשיבותו של השלטון המקומי וראינו כי רשויות שפעלו ועודדו את קידום העסקים הקטנים ומצאו פתרונות יצירתיים עבורם, הפכו לממשק השלטוני הראשון עבורם".
רן קויתי, מנהל הסוכנות לעסקים קטנים ובינוניים במשרד הכלכלה והתעשייה, מוסיף: "לרשויות המקומיות חלק מרכזי ומהותי ביכולתם של עסקים בתחומן לשגשג ולפרוח.
בשנתיים האחרונות, שבהן אנו מתמודדים עם משבר הקורונה, לרשויות משקל גדול יותר בסיוע לעסקים לשרוד בתחומן ולשרוד בכלל".
For the third time in a row: Ashdod—the most business—friendly city
Petah Tikva came in second for the business conducting ranking supported by the Ministry of Economy •
After them: Rehovot, Ashkelon and Rishon Lezion •
Minister Barbivay: "The Corona Virus has emphasized the importance of local municipality to business development"
Ashdod is the friendliest city for small and medium businesses.

This is the third year in a row—these are the findings of the index of conducting business in the local authorities of The Agency, for Small and Medium Businesses in the Ministry of Economy and Industry, which ranked the local authorities.
The city of Petah Tikva was ranked in the second place and Rehovot in third place.
After these cities, ranked by order are: Ashkelon, Rishon Lezion, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Haifa, Ramat Gan, Holon, Beer Sheva, Jerusalem, Bat Yam, Netanya and Bnei Brak.
The agency compiles the index of local authorities.

This index has been compiled for the fifth time and its purpose is to serve as a working tool for the local authority, as it allows each authority to compare its performance with the rest of authorities on a variety of parameters, as well as to analyze its performance in the areas of activity.
The index is based on several parameters that are tested in each authority, and examines the level of "friendliness" of the authority to the businesses in its region.

The index divides the authorities into three size groups according to the number of citizens, since a local authority of up to 50 thousand inhabitants is different from a local authority of more than 150 thousand citizens.
Tel Aviv leaped this year
The index is updated once a year and weighs four different ratings in each local authority: business satisfaction, accessibility to tenders, accessibility of information and property taxes.
The ranking shows that Ramat Gan dropped from second place to eighth place, Bat Yam dropped from fourth place to 12th place and Netanya dropped from fifth place to 13th place.

A drop in rating does not mean that the authority’s service to businesses has deteriorated, and in many cases it emanates from the fact that the service of other authorities to businesses has improved more and they have gone up in rating, while the authority that has dropped in rating has improved less in its services to businesses.
Among the improved in ranking, Petah Tikva maybe found, rising from sixth place to second place, and Rehovot, which rose from 12th place to third place.
Tel Aviv, which dropped from the fourth place to the 11th place in 2019, improved in 2021 and again improved to the sixth place this year.
"The business—engine of growth"
The ranking shows that Nof HaGalil leads the local authorities’ category, for city population of 50 to 150 thousand residents.
ranking after it are Kiryat Motzkin, Mateh Binyamin, Modi’in-Maccabim-Reut, Kfar Saba, Ra’anana, Nahariya, Karmiel, Afula and Hod Hasharon.
In the 28th and last place ranked, is Tiberias.

"The index is intended to encourage local authorities to make it easier for small and medium-sized businesses, starting from the time the business opens and during its active period with the authorities", says the Minister of Economy and Industry, Orna Barbivay.
"The businesses are a significant growth engine for the Israeli economy and are responsible for about 50% of the business output and about 60% of the economy employment.
The development of small businesses is the public interest for us all, but the local authority has a direct impact on the businesses located within local authority jurisdiction.

The Corona Virus emphasized the importance of local government and we saw that authorities that acted and encouraged promotion of small businesses and suggested creative solutions for them, became their primary governmental interface."

Ran Kivity, director of the Small and Medium Business Agency at the Ministry of Economy and Industry, adds: "Local authorities play a central and essential part in the ability of businesses to thrive and succeed.
In the previous two years, while coping with the Corona Virus crisis, the authorities have a greater influence in helping businesses to survive within their field and in general".

Petah Tikva reached second place in the business conduct rating of the Ministry of Economy.
Following them: Rehovot, Ashkelon and Rishon LeZion.

In the last two years, in which we are dealing with the Corona crisis, the authorities have a greater responsibility in helping businesses to survive in their field and to survive in general.

"The COVID-19 coronavirus highlighted the importance of local government and we saw that authorities that worked and encouraged the promotion of small businesses and found creative solutions for them, became the first governmental interface for them."

Ran Kaviti, director of the Small and Medium Business Agency at the Ministry of Economy and Industry, adds: "Local authorities play a central and essential part in the ability of businesses in their fields to thrive and flourish.
In the past two years, as we have been dealing with the COVID-19 crisis, the authorities have had more weight in helping businesses survive in their field and survive in general. "
For the third time in a row: Ashdod - the friendliest city for business.
Petah Tikva came in second place in the Ministry of Economy's Doing Business Ranking•
After them: Rehovot, Ashkelon and Rishon Lezion•
Minister Barbivai: "COVID-19 has emphasized the importance of local government in business development"
Ashdod is the friendliest city for small and medium businesses.
For the third year in a row, the Local Authorities Doing Business Index found by the Small and Medium Businesses Agency of the Ministry of Economy and Industry, which ranked local authorities.
In second place is the city of Petah Tikva and in third place Rehovot Rehovot Rehovot Rehovot.
After them are placed in order: Ashkelon, Rishon LeZion, Tel Aviv-Jaffa, Haifa, Ramat Gan, Holon, Be 'er Sheva, Jerusalem, Bat Yam, Dana and Bnei Brak, respectively.
The agency compiles the Local Authorities Index.

This is the fifth time and its purpose is to serve as a tool for the local authority, as it enables each authority to compare its performance to other authorities in a variety of parameters, as well as to analyze its performance in the areas in which it is active.
The index is based on several parameters examined in each authority, which examine the level of “ friendliness” of the authority to businesses located within its area.

The index divides the authorities into three size groups according to the number of inhabitants, since a local authority of up to 50, 000 inhabitants is not similar to a local authority of more than 150, 000 inhabitants.
Tel Aviv jumped this year.
The index is updated once a year and weighs four different ratings in each local authority: Business satisfaction, accessibility to tenders, accessibility of information and property taxes.
The ranking shows that Ramat Gan dropped from second place to eighth place, Bat Yam dropped from fourth place to 12th place and Netanya dropped from fifth place to 13th place.

A decline in the rating does not mean that the Authority's business service has deteriorated, and in many cases it is due to the fact that other business authorities' service has improved more and they have gone up in the ranking, while the authority that has dropped in the ranking has improved its business services less.
Among the immigrants in the ranking are Petah Tikva, which rose from sixth place to second place, and Rehovot, which rose from 12th place to third place.
Tel Aviv, which dropped from fourth place to 11th place in 2019, improved in 2021 and rose to sixth place.
"Business Growth Engine"
The ranking shows that Nof Galilee leads in local authorities, which include between 50, 000 and 150, 000 residents.
It is followed by Kiryat Motzkin, Mateh Binyamin, Modiin-Maccabi-Reut, Kfar Saba, Raanana, Nahariya, Karmiel, Afula and Hod Hasharon.
In 28th and last place is Tiberias.

“ The index is intended to encourage local authorities to make it easier for small and medium businesses, starting from the date the business opens and throughout its activity with the authorities,” says Minister of Economy and Industry, Orna Barbibai.
“ Businesses are a significant growth engine for the Israeli economy and are responsible for about 50% of the business product and about 60% of the employees in the economy.
The development of small businesses is in the public interest of all of us, but the local authority has a direct influence on its businesses.

COVID-19 emphasized the importance of local government and we saw that authorities that acted and encouraged the promotion of small businesses and found creative solutions for them, became the first governmental interface for them.

Ran Koiti, Director of the Agency for Small and Medium Businesses in the Ministry of Economy and Industry, adds: “ Local authorities play a key and essential role in the ability of businesses in their fields to thrive and flourish.
In the last two years, in which we are dealing with the coronavirus crisis, the authorities have a greater weight in helping businesses survive in their fields and survive in general.
2021 בדואר: 20 חבילות לכל משק בית - וזינוק במשקלן
46.6 מיליון חבילות הגיעו לישראל במהלך 2021 - בדומה ל־2020 •
המשקל הממוצע לחבילה עומד על 435 גרם - זינוק של 36% לעומת 2020 •
החודש העמוס ביותר: דצמבר, אז עמד משקל החבילה הממוצעת על 524 גרם.
בשנת 2021 הגיעו לישראל 46.6 מיליון חבילות דואר, כמעט 20 חבילות בממוצע לכל משק בית - כך עולה מנתוני דואר ישראל שהגיעו לידי "ישראל היום".
כמות החבילות שהגיעו ב־2021 דומה לשנת 2020, שבה הגיעו לישראל 46.5 מיליון חבילות, ונמוך מ־2019 - שבה הגיעו 61.6 מיליון חבילות.
עם זאת, השנה חל זינוק של יותר מ־36% בשנה במשקל החבילות שהגיעו מחו"ל.
ב־2021 הגיעו לישראל 20,253 טונות מוצרים מחו"ל, זינוק של 36% לעומת 14,860 טונות בשנת 2020, ו־16,743 טונות ב־2019.
שינויים בהרגלי הצריכה
המשקל הממוצע לחבילה זינק ב־60% בשנתיים - מ־272 גרם ב־2019 ל־435 גרם ב־2021.
הזינוק במשקל החבילות מושפע בעיקר משתי מגמות מרכזיות, הן מצד המוכר והן מצד הקונה: אתרי הקניות הגדולים בחו"ל מאחדים פריטים למשלוח אחד וכבר לא שולחים כל מוצר מ"סל הקניות" באריזה נפרדת.
מצד הצרכן הישראלי, המסירה המהירה של המשלוחים, בתוך ימים בודדים מרגע ההזמנה, תומכת ברכישה של יותר מוצרים יומיומיים כמו ביגוד ומתנות, שאותם הרוכשים מעוניינים לקבל בסמוך לביצוע הקנייה.
גם ב־2021, כמו ב־2020 וב־2019, החודש שבו הגיעו הכי חבילות מחו"ל במשקל הגבוה ביותר ומספר הפריטים הגבוה ביותר הוא חודש דצמבר, עם 4.2 מיליון חבילות במשקל כולל של 2,200 טונות.
בחודש דצמבר המשקל הממוצע לחבילה עמד על 524 גרם, גבוה ב־20% מהמשקל הממוצע השנתי.
אפקט בלאק פריידי
יותר חבילות הגיעו בדצמבר מבכל חודש אחר, ככל הנראה בעקבות חגי הקניות של נובמבר, דוגמת יום הרווקים הסיני, בלאק פריידי וסייבר מאנדיי.
ההזמנות הגדולות מתחילות להגיע לישראל בין שבוע לשבועיים לאחר הקנייה.
2021 by mail: 20 packages per household—and a rise in their weight
46.6 million packages arrived in Israel during 2021—similar to 2020 •
The average weight per package is 435 grams—a rise of 36% compared to 2020 •
The busiest month: December, when the average package weight was 524 grams.
In 2021, 46.6 million mail packages arrived to Israel, almost 20 packages on average per household—this is according to Israel Post data obtained by "Israel Hayom".
The amount of packages arriving in 2021 is similar to the amount in 2020, 46.5 million packages, and lower than 2019—61.6 million packages.
However, this year there was a jump of more than 36% per year in the weight of packages arriving from abroad.
In 2021, 20,253 tons of products from abroad arrived in Israel, a jump of 36% compared to 14,860 tons in 2020, and 16,743 tons in 2019.
Changes in consumption habits
The average weight per package jumped by 60% in two years—from 272 grams in 2019 to 435 grams in 2021.

The jump in package weight is mainly influenced by two major trends, both from the seller’s and the buyer’s side: the major shopping sites abroad combine items into one shipment and no longer send each product from the "shopping basket" in separate packaging.

On the part of the Israeli consumer, the fast delivery of the shipments, within a few days from the moment of the order, supports the purchase of more daily use products such as clothing and gifts, which those buyers wish to receive close to purchasing.

In 2021 as well as in 2020 and 2019, the month which the most packages arrived from abroad with the highest weight and the highest number of items, is December, 4.2 million packages of a total weight of 2,200 tons.
In December, the average weight per package was 524 grams, 20% higher than the annual average weight.
Black Friday effect
More packages arrived on December than any other month, probably following the November shopping holidays, such as Chinese Singles Day, Black Friday and Cyber Monday.
The large orders start arriving in Israel between one and two weeks after the purchase.

In 2021, 46 people arrived in Israel. 6 million mail packages, almost 20 packages on average per household, according to Israel Post data obtained by Israel Hayom.
The amount of packages that arrived in 2021 is similar to 2020, when 46 arrived in Israel. 5 million packages, and lower than 2019, when 61 came in. 6 million packages.
However, this year there was a jump of more than 36% per year in the weight of packages arriving from abroad.
In 2021, 20, 253 tons of products from abroad arrived in Israel, a jump of 36% compared to 14, 860 tons in 2020, and 16, 743 tons in 2019, respectively.
Changes in consumption habits.
The average weight per package jumped 60% in two years, from 272 grams in 2019 to 435 grams in 2021, from 435 grams in 2021.

The surge in package weight is mainly influenced by two main trends, both on the part of the seller and on the part of the buyer: The major overseas shopping sites consolidate items into one shipment and no longer ship each product from the “ shopping basket” in separate packaging.

On the part of the Israeli consumer, the rapid delivery of deliveries, within a few days from the moment of the order, supports the purchase of more everyday products such as clothing and gifts, which those buyers wish to receive close to making the purchase.

Also in 2021, as in 2020 and 2019, the month in which the highest weight and number of items arrived from abroad is December, with 4, with 4 arriving in December. 2 million packages weighing a total of 2, 200 tons.
In December, the average weight per package was 524 grams, 20% higher than the annual average weight.
Black Friday effect.
More packages arrived in December than in any other month, probably following November's shopping holidays, such as Chinese Singles Day, Black Friday and Cyber Monday.
The large orders begin arriving in Israel between one and two weeks after the purchase.
מחקר: רוב השכירים במשק לא מודעים לכך שניתן לקבל החזרי מס
לשכירים רבים מגיע כסף מהמדינה, שיכול להגיע לעשרות אלפי שקלים •
שיניתם מקום עבודה?
יצאתם לחל"ת?
עברתם מהעיר ליישוב?
ייתכן שאתם זכאים לקבל סכום לא מבוטל בהליך פשוט •
כל הפרטים - בפנים
רוב השכירים אינם מודעים לעובדה כי הם זכאים להחזרי מס, אשר יכולים להצטבר לסכומים גבוהים.
מבקר המדינה ציין בדו"ח מלפני כחודשיים כי שני מיליון שכירים זכאים להחזרי מס בגובה של 3.6 מילארד שקלים, מה שאומר שכדאי גם לכם לבדוק האם אתם זכאים לקבל החזרי מס.
שכירים רבים יכולים לקבל סכום גבוה, שכן ארבעה מתוך חמישה שכירים זכאים להחזרי למס.
בפועל לעומת זאת, מגישים כמה עשרות אלפי שכירים בשנה.
אם אתם חושבים כי ממילא הכספים הללו ירדו לטמיון, חישבו שנית: שכירים יכולים להגיש בקשה למס הכנסה להחזרים בגין שש שנים אחורה.
חברת Tax:On ביצעה מחקר עומק בקרב 4,000 מלקוחותיה בעניין החזרי המס במהלך שנת 2020.
לחברה למעלה מ-30 אלף לקוחות, כך שהמדגם משקף את הפיזור שלהם מבחינת קבוצות באוכלוסיה ומבחינת מגדר, גילאים וגיאוגרפיה.

מהנתונים עולה כי במהלך שנת 2020, בגלל התפרצות משבר הקורונה וההוצאה של מאות אלפי עובדים לחל״ת, חלו מספר שינויים משמעותיים ובמרכזם עלייה של 15% בגובה ההחזר הממוצע לבית אב שעמד על סכום של 4,300 שקלים בשנה.
הסיבה היא שדמי החל"ת הם נמוכים יותר מהמשכורות ולכן נוצר פער בין מה שהעובד שילם כמס למה שהוא צריך בפועל.
אגב, ההחזר הגבוה ביותר שקיבל בשנת 2020 לקוח של החברה עמד על סכום של 121,054 ש״ח בגין החזרים על 6 השנים האחרונות.
על מה אפשר לקבל החזרי מס?
אחת הסיבות לקבל החזרי מס היא שינוי במקום העבודה.
ל-81% מהאנשים שהחליפו מקום עבודה במהלך השנה נוצר החזר מס בסכום ממוצע של 2,943 שקלים.
סיבה נוספת היא חופשת לידה.
מהנתונים עולה כי 74% מהנשים שילדו וששהו בחופשת לידה מעל 16 שבועות היו זכאיות להחזר בגובה ממוצע של 3,538 שקלים על אותה שנה
סיבה נוספת להחזר היא תרומות.
100% מהאנשים התורמים ומשלמים מיסים קיבלו החזר.
גורם נוסף להחזר הוא אי רישום נקודות זיכוי בגין מזונות. 63%
מהגרושים לא עדכנו נקודת זיכוי בגין מזונות ולכן החזר המס לכל שנה שלא עודכנה נקודת זיכוי כזאת הינה 2,616 שקלים.
בשל אבטלה - הוצאה לחל״ת: 93% מהיוצאים לחלת או אבטלה ואשר הרוויחו מעל 12,000 שקלים קיבלו החזר מס בגובה 4021 שקלים לאותה שנה.
סיבות נוספות להחזרי מס הינן: החזר בגין תשלומי ביטוח חיים, ביטוח חיים על משכנתא ,החזר ישוב מזכה, החזר בגין הפסדים בניירות ערך ,אי רישום נקודות זיכוי לגבר בגין לידה וחלוקת החזרי מס לפי מקום גיאוגרפי.
- 94% מהאנשים שהפקידו לביטוח חיים אישי או בגין לקיחת משכנתא היו זכאים להחזר מס.
בבדיקה שנערכה על כל מיליון שקלים משכנתא ל-25 שנה, החזר המס המצטבר לתקופה הינו בגובה של מעל 20,000 שקלים לכל תקופת המשכנתא
100% מהעוברים לישוב מזכה קיבלו החזר מס על שנת המעבר היות ואישור על תושבות בישוב מזכה ניתנת רק לאחר 12 חודשים מיום הפיכת התושב לתושב מזכה ובכך למעשה השנה הראשונה משולם מס מלא.
79% מהלקוחות המחזיקים ניירות ערך היו זכאים להחזר מס השנים האמורות.
עם זאת, מי שמחזיק ניירות ערך חשוב שיבדוק כל שנה היות והפסדים לא מגולגלים משנה לשנה אלא רק דרך הגשת דוח.
56% מהגברים שנולד להם ילד לא רושמים נקודות זיכוי בשנת הלידה בתלוש השכר.
שיעור ההחזר יכול להגיע לעשרות אלפי שקלים לאורך 6 שנים.
זו תופעה הקיימת בעיקר במגזר הערבי.
מנכ״ל tax:on, טל כרמון: "משבר הקורונה גרם לכך שציבור השכירים בישראל הפך להרבה יותר אקטיבי.
הוא מתעניין, בודק ודורש את מה שמגיע לו בהחזרים ממס הכנסה.
מתברר שהישיבה בבית, בחל״ת או אחרי פיטורים, של מאות אלפי ישראלים במשך חודשים ארוכים, גרמה לשכירים רבים לבדוק לעומק מה מגיע להם מהמדינה.
חשוב לדעת שכיום ניתן לבצע את כל ההליכים לקבלת החזרי מס באופן דיגיטלי, קל ופשוט, בלי הבירוקרטיה שהרתיעה רבים בעבר״.
Research: Most employees are unaware of the possibility to receive tax refunds
Many employees are entitled to receive funds from the state, that can reach tens of thousands of NIS •
Have you changed place of work?
Did you go on a leave of absence?
Did you move from the city to a settlement?
You may be entitled to receive a significant amount following a simple procedure •
All the details are enclosed
Most employees are unaware that they are entitled to tax refunds, which can add up to high sums.

The State Comptroller stated in a report published about two months ago, that two million employees are entitled to tax refunds of 3.6 billion NIS, meaning you should also check whether you are entitled to receive tax refunds.
Many employees can receive a high amount of money, considering that four out of five employees are entitled to tax refunds.
Actually, only several tens of thousands of employees per year apply for it.
If you think these funds are lost anyway, think again: employees can apply to the IRS for refunds for six years retroactively.
The Tax:On company has conducted an in-depth study among 4,000 of its customers regarding tax refunds during the year of 2020.
The company has over 30 thousand customers, so the sample reflects their dispersion in terms of groups in the population and in terms of gender, ages and geography.

The data shows that during the year 2020, due to the outbreak of the Corona Virus crisis and hundreds of thousands of workers taking unpaid vacation, a few significant changes took place, mainly a 15% increase of the amount of the average refund per family, which amounted to 4,300 NIS per year.
The reason is that the unpaid vacation dues are lower than the salaries, so there is a gap between the employee payments and what he actually needs.
By the way, the highest refund paid in 2020 to a client of the company was 121,054 NIS for refunds over the past 6 years.
What can you get tax refunds for?
One of the reasons for receiving tax refunds is changing jobs.
81% of the people who changed jobs during the year received a tax refund in the average amount of 2,943 NIS.
Another reason is maternity leave.
The data shows that 74% of the women who gave birth and were on maternity leave for more than 16 weeks were entitled to a refund in the average amount of 3,538 NIS for that year
Another reason for tax refund is donations.
100% of people donating and paying taxes got a refund.
Another factor for tax refund is not registering credit points for alimony. 63%
Of divorced people have not updated a credit point for alimony, thus the tax refund for each year of not updating a credit point is 2,616 NIS.
Due to unemployment—going on unpaid vacation: 93% of those who went for unpaid leave or unemployment and earned over 12,000 NIS received a tax refund of 4,021 NIS for that year.

Other reasons for tax refunds are: refund for life insurance payments, life insurance on a mortgage, refund for living in a settlement qualifying for refund, refund for losses in securities, failure to register credit points for a man due to a birth and tax refunds according to geographic location of residence.
- 94% of the people who deposited installments for personal life insurance or for taking out a mortgage were entitled to a tax refund.
In an inspection conducted on every million NIS of a 25-year mortgage, the cumulative tax refund for the period is over 20,000 NIS for the entire mortgage period

100% of those who move to a qualifying settlement received a tax refund for the year of the move since confirmation of residency in a qualifying settlement is given only after 12 months from the day the resident became a qualified resident, therefor effectively the first year full tax is paid.
79% of the customers holding securities were entitled to a tax refund for the aforementioned years.
However, it is important for those who hold securities to check every year since losses are not rolled over from year to year but only by submission of a report.
56% of the men who had a child do not record credit points in the year of birth on the payslip.
The refund can amount as high as tens of thousands of NIS over 6 years.
This phenomenon exists mainly in the Arab sector.
CEO of Tax:On, Tal Carmon: "The Corona Virus crisis has meant that the employed in Israel have become much more active.
They show interest, check and demand the refunds they deserve from the income tax.

It turns out that hundreds of thousands of Israelis sitting at home for many months, on an unpaid leave or after layoffs, caused many employees to inspect deeply at their rights and what they deserve from the state.
It is important to know that today all procedures for receiving tax refunds can be carried out digitally, easily and simply, without the bureaucracy that deterred many in the past."

Due to unemployment - Expenditure on the US: 93% of those who went to work or unemployment and who earned more than 12,000 shekels received a tax refund of 4021 shekels for that year.

Other reasons for a tax refund are: a refund for life insurance payments, life insurance on a mortgage, a refund for a capital gain, a refund for losses in securities, no registration of credit points for a man for birth and a split of the tax refund by geographical location.

The company has more than 30, 000 customers, so the sample reflects their distribution in terms of population groups and in terms of gender, ages and geography, the sample reflects their distribution in terms of population groups and in terms of gender, ages and geography.

The data show that during 2020, due to the outbreak of the coronavirus crisis and the expenditure of hundreds of thousands of workers for unpaid leave, there were a number of significant changes, centered on a 15% increase in the average return to a household, which amounted to NIS 4, 300 per year. NIS 4, 300 per year.
The reason is that the unpaid leave fees are lower than the salaries, so there is a gap between what the worker paid as tax and what he actually needs.
By the way, the highest refund received in 2020 by a customer of the company was NIS 121, 054 for repayments over the past 6 years.
What can you get tax refunds for?
One of the reasons to get tax refunds is a change in the workplace.
81% of people who changed jobs during the year received a tax refund of NIS 2, 943 on average.
Another reason is maternity leave.
The data shows that 74% of women who gave birth and were on maternity leave for more than 16 weeks were entitled to a refund in the average amount of NIS 3, 538 for that year.
Another reason for reimbursement is donations.
100% of donors and taxpayers have received a refund.
Another factor in the refund is the failure to register credit points for alimony. 63% is.
The divorced did not update a credit point for alimony, so the tax refund for each year that has not been updated, such a credit point is NIS 2, 616.
Due to unemployment unpaid leave expenditure: 93% of those who were sick or unemployed and who earned over NIS 12, 000 received a tax refund of NIS 4021 for that year.

Other reasons for tax returns are: Reimbursement for life insurance payments, mortgage life insurance, qualifying settlement reimbursement, reimbursement for securities losses, failure to register credit points for a man for childbirth and distribution of tax returns by geographical location.
- 94% of people who deposited for personal life insurance or for taking out a mortgage were entitled to a tax refund.
In an examination conducted on every NIS 1 million 25-year mortgage, the cumulative tax refund for the period is over NIS 20, 000 for the entire mortgage period.

100% of those who move to a qualifying locality received a tax refund for the transition year, since confirmation of residency in a qualifying locality is given only after 12 months from the date the resident becomes a qualifying resident, thus effectively the first year full tax is paid in full.
79% of the customers holding securities were entitled to a tax refund for the said years.
However, it is important for those who hold securities to check every year since losses are not rolled over from year to year but only through the submission of a report.
56% of men who have had a child do not register credit points in the year of birth on the pay slip.
The rate of repayment can reach tens of thousands of shekels over 6 years.
This is a phenomenon that exists mainly in the Arab sector.
CEO of tax:on, Tal Carmon: “ The coronavirus crisis has caused the salaried public in Israel to become much more active.
He is interested, checks and demands what he deserves in returns from the IRS.
It turns out that sitting at home, on unpaid leave or after layoffs, of hundreds of thousands of Israelis for many months, caused many employees to examine in depth what they deserve from the state.
It is important to know that today it is possible to carry out all the procedures for receiving tax returns digitally, easily and simply, without the bureaucracy that deterred many in the past” .
שוק התעסוקה: פחות מועמדים למשרה, יותר שכר
דו"ח אולג'ובס לסיכום 2021: בראש הביקושים - משרות ללא ניסיון •
היקף המשרות שהוצעו עלה ב-50% •
"מחפשים עבודה, אך לא מסתערים על השוק"

בשנה שהסתיימה זה עתה חלה ירידה של 15% במספר קורות החיים שנשלחו, ועל כל תפקיד התמודדו בממוצע 23 מועמדים בלבד, לעומת 41 מועמדים בשנה הקודמת - כך עולה מדו"ח של אתר אולג'ובס לסיכום שנת 2021, על משבר הקורונה והשפעותיו על שוק העבודה בישראל.
לפי הדו"ח, מחפשי העבודה התעניינו בעיקר בתחומים רוויי משרות כמו אדמיניסטרציה ומכירות, שלגביהן נשלחו 1,738,485 קורות חיים.
עם זאת, המשרות ללא ניסיון הובילו בראש הביקושים עם יותר מ-38 אלף חיפושים - כנראה בעקבות חזרה של צעירים חסרי ניסיון מקצועי לחיפוש אחר עבודה מיידית, בתום תשלומי החל"ת.
מספר החיפושים למכירות ולאדמיניסטרציה היה 35 אלף ו-32 אלף (בהתאמה), לנהגים ולשליחים היו 11 אלף חיפושים, ולשמירה היו מעט פחות מ-9,000 חיפושים.
מאידך, למרות משבר הקורונה, השכר בשנת 2021 עלה ב-2% בהשוואה לשנת 2020, והשכר הממוצע בישראל עמד על 11,675 שקלים ברוטו.
השכר החודשי בתחום התוכנה היה 17,915 שקלים בממוצע, ובניתוח מערכות מידע הוא עמד על 17,140 שקלים.
עם זאת, בין המרכז לפריפריה היה קיים פער שכר של יותר מ-2,000 שקלים: במרכז הארץ הוא היה 12,500 שקלים בממוצע, לעומת 10,795 בצפון ו-10,135 שקלים בדרום.
מבחינה מגדרית, פער השכר הממוצע בין נשים לגברים, שאותו ניתן להסביר גם בסוג העבודה ובהיקפי השעות, נשמר ועמד על 36%.
גברים השתכרו 13,295 שקלים, לעומת שכר הנשים שעמד על 9,740 שקלים.
מנסים לחזור לתלם
בצד של העסקים, נרשמה צמיחה רוחבית כמעט בכל ענפי המשק, והעסקים השתוקקו לידיים עובדות.
כך, היצע המשרות עלה ב-50% ורשם שיא של יותר מ-40 אלף משרות באולג'ובס.
סקר שערך האתר בקרב מעסיקים מצא כי 50% היו אופטימיים לגבי הסטטוס הכלכלי שלהם ב-2022, 30% מהם העידו על כוונתם להגדיל את סך הגיוסים אך 72% מבינים שיתקשו בכך השנה.
ההיצע הגדול ביותר היה למשרות ללא ניסיון - וכאלה היו יותר מ-58 אלף באתר.
אחריהן היו תפקידי שירות לקוחות ואדמיניסטרציה עם כ-44 אלף משרות בכל תחום, מכירות ותוכנה עם 41 אלף משרות כל אחת, הוראה וחינוך עם 24 אלף משרות פנויות, ומחסנאים עדיין מבוקשים ב-19 אלף משרות פנויות.
עינב בוימפלד, מנהלת המחקר והתוכן באולג'ובס: "מחפשי העבודה מנסים לחזור לתלם אך אינם מסתערים על השוק, בעיקר בשל היעדר משרות אטרקטיביות בעיניהם.
כמו כן, הנתק הממושך ממעגל העבודה מקשה עליהם לחזור, וחלקם מצאו אופנים יצירתיים להתפרנס".
The job market: fewer job applicants, more pay
AllJobs 2021 summary report: the top of demand—jobs without experience •
The scope of jobs offered increased by 50% •
"Looking for a job, but not storming the market"

During the year just ended, there was a 15% decrease in the number of resumes sent, and for each position only 23 candidates competed on average, compared to 41 candidates on the previous year—according to a report by AllJobs website summarizing the year 2021, on the Corona Virus crisis and its effects on the labor market in Israel.
According to the report, the job seekers were mainly interested in areas saturated with jobs such as administration and sales, for which 1,738,485 CVs were sent.

However, the jobs without experience led the demand with more than 38 thousand searches—probably due to the come back of young people with no professional experience looking for immediate work, at the end of the unpaid leave payments.
The number of searches for sales and administration was 35,000 and 32,000 (respectively), drivers and couriers had 11,000 searches, and guarding jobs had just under 9,000 searches.
On the other hand, despite the Corona Virus crisis, wages in 2021 increased by 2% compared to 2020, and the average gross salary in Israel was 11,675 NIS.
The average monthly salary in the software field was 17,915 NIS, and in information systems analysis it was 17,140 NIS.

However, between the center and the periphery there was a salary gap of more than 2,000 NIS: in the center of the country it was 12,500 NIS on average, compared to 10,795 NIS in the north and 10,135 NIS in the south.
From a gender perspective, the average wage gap between women and men, which can also be explained by the type of work and the number of hours, remained at 36%.
Men earned 13,295 NIS, compared to women’s wages of 9,740 NIS.
Trying to get back on track
As for the business aspect, horizontal growth was recorded in almost all branches of the economy, and businesses craved for working hands.
Thus, the offer of jobs increased by 50% and recorded a record of more than 40 thousand jobs in AllJobs.

A survey conducted by the site among employers revealed that 50% were optimistic about their economic status in 2022, 30% of them testified that they intend to increase the total number of hires, but 72% understand that they will have difficulty doing so this year.
The largest offer was for jobs without experience—more than 58 thousand of them were on the site.

the amount of customer service and administration positions followed with approximately 44,000 jobs in each field, sales and software with 41,000 jobs each, teaching and education with 24,000 vacancies, and warehouse workers still in demand with 19,000 vacancies.

Einav Boimfeld, director of research and content at AllJobs: "The job seekers are trying to get back on track but are not storming the market, mainly due to the lack of jobs that they find as attractive to them.
Also, the prolonged disconnection from the work circle makes it difficult for them to come back, and some have found creative ways to make a living".
Job market: Fewer candidates for a position, higher salary.
Oljobs' 2021 summary report: At the top of the demands - jobs without experience.
The volume of jobs offered increased by 50%.
"Looking for work, but not rushing into the market"

In the past year, there was a 15% decrease in the number of resumes sent, and only an average of 23 candidates competed for each position, compared to 41 candidates in the previous year - according to a report by AllJobs website summarizing 2021, on the Corona crisis and its effects on the job market in Israel.
According to the report, job seekers were mainly interested in fields with many positions such as administration and sales, for which 1,738,485 resumes were sent.

However, the jobs without experience led the demand with more than 38 thousand searches - probably due to the return of young people without professional experience looking for immediate work, after the end of unemployment benefits.

The number of searches for sales and administration was 35 thousand and 32 thousand respectively, for drivers and couriers there were 11 thousand searches, and for security there were slightly less than 9,000 searches.
On the other hand, despite the Corona crisis, the salary in 2021 increased by 2% compared to 2020, and the average salary in Israel was 11,675 shekels gross.
The average monthly salary in the software field was 17,915 shekels, and in information systems analysis, it was 17,140 shekels.

However, there was a wage gap of more than 2,000 shekels between the center and the periphery: in the center of the country it was an average of 12,500 shekels, compared to 10,795 in the north and 10,135 shekels in the south.
From a gender perspective, the average wage gap between women and men, which can also be explained by the type of work and the number of hours, remained at 36%.
Men earned 13,295 shekels, compared to women's wages which stood at 9,740 shekels.
Trying to get back on track.
On the business side, there was almost across-the-board growth in all sectors of the economy, and businesses were desperate for workers.
Thus, the job supply increased by 50% and recorded a record of more than 40,000 jobs on AllJobs.

A survey conducted by the site among employers found that 50% were optimistic about their economic status in 2022, 30% of them indicated their intention to increase the total recruitments but 72% understand that they will struggle with it this year.
The largest supply was for jobs without experience - there were more than 58 thousand on the site.

Following them were customer service and administration roles with about 44,000 jobs in each field, sales and software with 41,000 jobs each, teaching and education with 24,000 available jobs, and warehouse workers are still in demand with 19,000 available jobs.

Einav Boimfeld, the research and content manager at AllJobs: "Job seekers are trying to get back on track but they are not rushing into the market, mainly due to the lack of attractive positions in their eyes.
Also, the prolonged disconnection from the work cycle makes it difficult for them to return, and some of them have found creative ways to make a living.

A survey conducted by the site among employers found that 50% were optimistic about their economic status in 2022, 30% of them testified that they intend to increase the total number of hires, but 72% understand that they will have difficulty doing so this year.
The largest offer was for jobs without experience - and there were more than 58 thousand of them on the site.

They were followed by customer service and administration positions with approximately 44,000 jobs in each field, sales and software with 41,000 jobs each, teaching and education with 24,000 vacancies, and warehouse workers still in demand with 19,000 vacancies.

Einav Boimfeld, director of research and content at AllJobs: "The job seekers are trying to get back into the groove but are not attacking the market, mainly due to the lack of attractive jobs in their eyes.
Also, the prolonged disconnection from the work circle makes it difficult for them to return, and some have found creative ways to make a living."
Job Market: Fewer Job applicants, more wages
2021 Jobs Report: Top of the Demand - Jobs without Experience •
The number of jobs offered increased by 50% •
Looking for a job, but not hitting the market

In the year that just ended, there was a 15% decrease in the number of résumés sent, and for each job, an average of 23 candidates were nominated, compared to 41 candidates in the previous year - according to a report by the Oljobs website for the conclusion of 2021, on the Coronavirus crisis and its effects on the labor market in Israel.
According to the report, job seekers were most interested in job-saturated areas such as administration and sales, for which 1,738,485 resumes were sent.

However, the inexperienced jobs led the demand with more than 38,000 searches - probably due to the return of young people without professional experience to search for immediate work at the end of their starting salaries.
The number of sales and administration searches was 35,000 and 32,000 (respectively), drivers and couriers had 11,000 searches, and guards had just under 9,000 searches.
On the other hand, despite the Corona crisis, wages in 2021 increased by 2% compared to 2020, and the average salary in Israel was NIS 11,675 gross.
The monthly salary in software was NIS 17,915 on average, and in information systems analysis it was NIS 17,140.

However, between the center and the periphery, there was a wage gap of more than NIS 2,000: in the center of the country, it was NIS 12,500 on average, compared with NIS 10,795 in the north and NIS 10,135 in the south.
In terms of gender, the average pay gap between women and men, which can also be explained by the type of work and the volume of hours, was maintained at 36%.
Men earned NIS 13,295, compared to women's NIS 9,740.
Trying to get back on track
On the business side, lateral growth was recorded in almost all sectors of the economy, and businesses craved working hands.
Thus, the supply of jobs increased by 50% and recorded a record of more than 40,000 job openings.
A survey of employers by the website found that 50% were optimistic about their economic status in 2022, 30% indicated their intention to increase hiring, but 72% said they would struggle this year.
The largest supply was for inexperienced jobs-more than 58,000 on the site.

They were followed by customer service and administration positions with 44,000 positions in each field, sales and software with 41,000 positions each, teaching and education with 24,000 vacancies, and warehouses still in demand with 19,000 vacancies.
Einav Boimfeld, Director of Research and Content at All Jobs: "Job seekers are trying to get back on track but are not storming the market, mainly due to the lack of attractive jobs in their eyes.

הלמ"ס: שיעור האבטלה בישראל עלה ל-6.3%
מנתוני סקר הלשכה עולה כי כ-270 אלף ישראלים נותרו מחוסרי עבודה בחודש דצמבר 2021 •
בנובמבר היו כ-262 אלף מובטלים
אחוז המובטלים במחצית הראשונה של חודש דצמבר 2021 עמד על 6.3%, כ-270 אלף ישראלים, לעומת 6.1% במחצית השנייה של נובמבר 2021 (כ-262 אלף).
כך עולה מנתוני סקר כוח אדם למחצית הראשונה של חודש דצמבר 2021 של הלשכה המרכזית לסטטיסטיקה.
אחוז הבלתי מועסקים עמד על 4.5% במחצית הראשונה של דצמבר 2021 לעומת 4.3% במחצית השנייה של נובמבר 2021.
במילים אחרות, מדובר ב- 193 אלף לא מועסקים לעומת 180.3 אלף.
לפי תכונות כוח העבודה במחצית הראשונה של דצמבר 2021 בקרב בני 15 ומעלה עולה כי אוכלוסיה זו כללה 6,607,500 תושבים בישראל, לא כולל מוסדות וגרים מחוץ לישובים.
מתוכם 64.4%, כלומר 4,252,700 הם בכוח העבודה והשאר המהווים 2,354,800 אינם בכוח העבודה.
מאלה שבכוח העבודה 95.5% המהווים 4,059,700 הם מועסקים והשאר בלתי מועסקים.
מאלה אשר אינם בכוח העבודה, 2.3% הפסיקו לעבוד בגלל פיטורים או סגירת העבודה ממרץ 2020.
סקר כוח אדם מספק מידע על כוח העבודה בישראל והוא נערך באופן שוטף על ידי הלשכה המרכזית לסטטיסטיקה.
במחצית הראשונה של חודש דצמבר 2021 רואיינו באופן שוטף כ-8,700 בני 15 ומעלה.
במחצית השנייה של חודש נובמבר 2021 רואיינו באופן שוטף כ-8,900 בני 15 ומעלה.
אוכלוסיית הסקר כוללת את התושבים הקבועים של מדינת ישראל, תיירים ותושבים ארעיים השוהים בישראל יותר משנה ברציפות.
הסקר מאפשר מעקב אחר ההתפתחות בכוח העבודה, גודלו ותכונותיו, היקף האבטלה ועוד.
CBS: The unemployment rate in Israel rose to 6.3%
According to the Bureau’s survey data, approximately 270,000 Israelis remained unemployed in December 2021 •
In November there were about 262,000 unemployed
The percentage of unemployed in the first half of December 2021 was 6.3%, about 270,000 Israelis, compared to 6.1% in the second half of November 2021 (about 262,000).
This is according to the human resources survey data for the first half of December 2021 of the Central Bureau of Statistics.
The percentage of the unemployed was 4.5% in the first half of December 2021 compared to 4.3% in the second half of November 2021.
In other words, 193,000 unemployed in comparison to 180,300.

According to the characteristics of the workforce in the first half of December 2021 among those aged 15 and over, it appears that this population consists of 6,607,500 Israeli residents, excluding institutions and those living out of the settlements.
Out of which, 64.4%, i.e. 4,252,700 are in the labor force and the rest, which is 2,354,800, are not in the labor force.
Of the labor force, 95.5%, which is 4,059,700, are employed and the rest are unemployed.
Of those not in the labor force, 2.3% stopped working due to layoffs or job closures as of March 2020.
A labor force survey provides information on the labor force in Israel and is conducted regularly by the Central Bureau of Statistics.
At the first half of December 2021, approximately 8,700 people aged 15 and over were interviewed on an ongoing basis.
At the second half of November 2021, approximately 8,900 people aged 15 and over were interviewed on an ongoing basis.
The survey population includes the permanent residents of the State of Israel, tourists and temporary residents who have been staying in Israel for more than a year continuously.
The survey enables monitoring the development of the labor force, its size and characteristics, the extent of unemployment and more.

Of those in the workforce, 95.5%, which is 4,059,700, are employed and the rest are unemployed.
Of those not in the labor force, 2.3% stopped working due to layoffs or job closures as of March 2020.
A labor force survey provides information on the labor force in Israel and is conducted regularly by the Central Bureau of Statistics.
In the first half of December 2021, approximately 8,700 people aged 15 and over were interviewed on an ongoing basis.
In the second half of November 2021, approximately 8,900 people aged 15 and over were interviewed on an ongoing basis.
The survey population includes the permanent residents of the State of Israel, tourists and temporary residents who stay in Israel for more than a year continuously.
The survey enables monitoring of the development of the labor force, its size and characteristics, the extent of unemployment and more.
Israel's unemployment rate rises to 6.3%
The Bureau's survey data shows that about 270,000 Israelis remained unemployed in December 2021 •
There were 262,000 unemployed people in November.
The unemployment rate in the first half of December 2021 was 6.3%, about 270,000 Israelis, compared to 6.1% in the second half of November 2021 (about 262,000).
This is according to the data of the Labor Force Survey for the first half of December 2021 of the Central Bureau of Statistics.
The jobless rate was 4.5% in the first half of December 2021, compared with 4.3% in the second half of November 2021.
In other words, that's 193,000 unemployed versus 180.3 thousand.

According to the characteristics of the labor force in the first half of December 2021 among those aged 15 and over, this population consisted of 6,607,500 residents in Israel, not including institutions and those living outside the localities.
Of these, 64.4 per cent, meaning 4,252,700 are in the workforce and the remainder of 2,354,800 are not in the workforce.
Of those in the labor force, 95.5 percent, who make up 4,059,700, are employed and the rest are underemployed.
Of those not in the workforce, 2.3% stopped working because of layoffs or job closings from March 2020.
The Manpower Survey provides information about the labor force in Israel and is regularly conducted by the Central Bureau of Statistics.
In the first half of December 2021, 8,700 people aged 15 and over were interviewed regularly.
In the second half of November 2021, 8,900 people aged 15 and over were interviewed regularly.
The survey population includes permanent residents of the State of Israel, tourists and temporary residents who have been in Israel for more than a year in a row.
The survey allows tracking of the development of the labor force, its size and characteristics, the extent of unemployment, and more.

"לא מובן מאליו": סאבלימינל מקדש את השבת - ומתכונן לעצמאות
חוגג את העובדה ש"אנחנו יכולים לחיות כמו שבא לנו", מתרגש לקראת המפגש עם הקהל ומקפיד לבלות עם הילדים •
סוף השבוע ויום העצמאות של קובי שמעוני, סאבלימינל
איך נראה יום שישי טיפוסי שלך?
"סופי השבוע הם הרגעים החשובים בחיים, מבחינתי.
הקידוש והמסורת הם שורש מאוד עמוק בנשמה שלי.
ימי שישי אצלי מוקדשים לילדים, אור (10) ויונתן (8).
אני אוסף אותם מבית הספר, אנחנו קונים פרחים ומצרכים לקידוש, אוכלים צהריים ועושים משהו כיפי ביחד, כמו לשחק כדורגל, לרכוב על סוסים או לשחק במכוניות על שלט.
לפעמים הולכים לים, או אפילו סתם לרחוץ את הרכב, אבל תמיד עוצרים בדרך לקנות מתנה בחנות הצעצועים בשכונה - ותמיד יש תירוץ אחר.
כשחוזרים הביתה עם שלל המתנות, ריחות הבישולים מקבלים את פנינו".
איך נראית ארוחת שישי שלכם?
"בורכתי בבשלניות סביבי.
מהצד שלי יש מטבח פרסי־תוניסאי, מלא סלטים ואווירה של צחוקים, מוזיקה, שירה ושמחה.
מהצד של אשתי אינס, שהיא גם בשלנית נהדרת, מגיעים המאכלים האוקראיניים, שהם עמוקים וחריפים, עם הרבה בשר.
כשאנחנו מגיעים לחמותי, כבר מלובי הבניין עולים ריחות מדהימים מהדירה שלה.
לרוב אני עושה את הקידוש, יחד עם הילדים, שמכירים אותו בעל פה.
בסופו של דבר, הכיף שלי אחרי האוכל זה להתעלף על השטיח, ושהילדים קופצים עלי כאילו אני איזה מתנפח".
יש לך זיכרון ילדות מיוחד מסופי השבוע?
"כילד, הייתי מתעורר בשבת לצלילי מוזיקה ישראלית ברשת ג' ולמערכוני הגשש החיוור, שידענו בעל פה.
אבא שלי אהב טבע וטיילנו המון בארץ ישראל, בדרך כלל לצפון.
כל פינה נידחת בארץ עשתה לו גאווה בלב.
הוא נפטר לפני שלושה חודשים ממחלה קשה, ובשבילו קידוש ושבת היו קודש הקודשים, בעיקר מהבחינה שכל המשפחה צריכה להיות יחד.
לאחרונה הוצאתי שיר לזכרו בשם 'שומר עליך', שיצרתי עם אושר כהן.
אני מאמין שהוא היה גאה ביצירה הזו, שמקדשת את הקשר בין אבא לבן".
בקרוב נציין את יום העצמאות ה־74. כציוני נלהב, מה התחושות שלך לגבי החג?
"יום העצמאות הוא יום קדוש בשבילי, וחלק מהמשמעות ומהזהות שלי.
בפרס ובתוניסיה הוריי נאלצו להסתיר את הזהות היהודית שלהם, ואילו אני יהודי־ישראלי שזוכה לחיות עם ילדיו במדינה שלנו.
שבוע־שבועיים לפני יום העצמאות כבר הייתי מטפס על עצים וקושר לבית חוטים עם דגלי ישראל.
היום ימי העצמאות שלי מלאים בהופעות, ותמיד פוגשים קהל שמח בטירוף, שחוגג את זה שאנחנו יכולים לחיות כמו שבא לנו.
צריך לשמור שגם לילדים, לנכדים ולנינים שלנו תהיה האפשרות הזו, ולזכור ששום דבר פה לא מובן מאליו".
"Not obvious": Subliminal sanctifies the Sabbath—and prepares for Independence Day
Celebrates the fact that "we can live the way we want", gets excited about meeting the audience and makes sure to spend time with the children •
The weekend and Independence Day of Kobi Shimoni, Subliminal
What does your typical Friday look like?
"Weekends are the most important moments in life, as far as I’m concerned.
Saturday’s sanctification and tradition are deeply rooted in my soul.
My Fridays are dedicated to the children, Orr (10) and Jonathan (8).
I pick them up from school, we buy flowers and groceries for Saturday’s sanctification, have lunch and do something fun together, like play soccer, ride horses or play with toy motor cars.
Sometimes we go to the beach, or even just to wash the car, but we always stop on the way to buy a gift at the toy store in the neighborhood—and there is always different excuse for it.
When we return home with the multitude of gifts, the smells of cooking greet us".
How does your Friday’s dinner look like?
"I was blessed since I am surrounded by cooking women.
On my side of the family there is a Persian-Tunisian cuisine, lots of salads and an ambience of laughter, music, singing and joy.
on my wife’s side, who is also a great cook, are the Ukrainian dishes, which are profound and spicy, with a lot of meat.
When we arrive at my mother-in-law’s, from the lobby of the building, you can already smell the amazing aromas coming from her apartment.
I usually do the Saturday’s sanctification, together with the children, who know it by heart.
In the end, my fun after eating is passing out on the carpet, and having the kids jump on me like I’m some kind of an inflatable".
Do you have a special childhood memory from the weekends?
"As a child, I would wake up on Shabbat to the sounds of Israeli music on Channel C and the skits of ‘Hagashash Hakhiver’, which we knew by heart.
My father loved nature and we traveled a lot in Israel, mostly to the north part of the country.
Every remote location of the country made his heart proud.
He died three months ago from a serious illness, and for him Saturday’s sanctification and Shabbat were the holiest of holies, especially believing that the whole family should come together.
I recently released a song in his memory called 'Shomer Alecha', which I created with Osher Cohen.
I believe he would have been proud of this creation, which sanctifies the bond between father and son".
Soon we will celebrate Israel’s 74th Independence Day. As an avid Zionist, what are your feelings about the holiday?
"Independence Day is a sacred day for me, and part of my meaning and identity.
In Persia and Tunisia my parents had to hide their Jewish identity, while I am an Israeli Jew who is privileged to live with his children in our country.
A week or two before Independence Day I already climbed trees and attached strings with Israeli flags to the house.
Today, my days of independence are packed with shows and performances, and I always meet an insanely happy crowd, celebrating the fact that we can live as we please.
We need to ensure that our children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren also have this option, and remember that nothing here is taken for granted".
"Taken for granted": Subliminal sanctifies the Sabbath - and prepares for independence.
Celebrates the fact that "we can live as we please", excited to meet the audience and makes sure to spend time with the kids.

"Uncertain": Subliminal sanctifies the Sabbath - and prepares for independence
Celebrating "we can live as we wish", gets excited about meeting the audience and makes sure to spend time with the children
The weekend and the independence day of Kobe Shimon, Sublime.
What's your typical Friday look like?
"The weekends are the most important moments in my life.
Holiness and tradition are very deeply rooted in my soul.
Friday nights are for the children, Orr (10) and Jonathan (8).
I pick them up from school, we buy flowers and sacraments, have lunch and do something fun together, like play soccer, ride horses or play cars on the sign.
Sometimes we go to the beach or even just to wash the car, but we always stop to buy a gift at the neighborhood toy store - there's always another excuse.
When we come home with the spoils of the gifts, the smells of the cooking greet us".
How's your Friday dinner look?
I've been blessed with cooks around me.
Next to me is Persian-Tunisian cuisine, full of salads and an atmosphere of laughter, music, song and joy.
On the part of my wife Ines, who's also a great cook, comes the Ukrainian food, which is deep and spicy, with a lot of meat.
By the time we get to my mother-in-law, the lobby of the building already emits incredible scents from her apartment.
I usually do the consecration with the children, who know it by heart.
After all, my pleasure after dinner is passing out on the carpet, and the kids jumping on me like I'm some kind of bloat".
Do you have any special childhood memories from the weekends?
"As a child, I would wake up on Saturdays to the sounds of Israeli music on the j network and the pale radar channels which we knew by heart.
My father loved nature and we traveled a lot in the Land of Israel, usually to the north.
Every remote corner of the land made his heart proud.
He passed away three months ago from a serious illness, and for him Lent and the Sabbath were holy days, especially since the whole family has to be together.
I recently released a song in his honor called "Warding of You", which I wrote with Usher Cohen.
I believe he would have been proud of this piece, which celebrates the bond between father and son".
As an ardent Zionist, how do you feel about the holiday?
"Independence Day is a sacred day to me, and part of my meaning and identity.
In Persia and Tunisia, my parents had to hide their Jewish identity, while I am an Israeli Jew who is allowed to live with his children in our country.
A week or two before Independence Day, I was already climbing trees and being tied to a house of wires with Israeli flags.
Now my days of independence are filled with gigs, always met with a raving and happy crowd, celebrating that we can live the way we want.
We must ensure that our children, our grandchildren and our great-grandchildren are given that choice, as well, and remember that nothing is taken for granted".
'Not self-evident': Subliminal sanctifies Shabbat - and prepares for independence
Celebrating the fact that "we can live the way we want", getting excited about meeting the audience and making sure to spend time with the children •
Kobi Shimoni's Independence Day and Weekend, Subliminal
What does your typical Friday look like?
"Weekends are the most important moments in life, for me.
Kiddush and tradition are very deep roots in my soul.
Fridays at my place are dedicated to the children, Or (10) and Yonatan (8).
I pick them up from school, we buy flowers and kiddush supplies, have lunch and do something fun together, like play soccer, ride horses, or play cars on a sign.
Sometimes you go to the beach, or even just wash the car, but you always stop on the way to buy a gift at the toy store in the neighborhood – and there's always another excuse.
When we return home with all the gifts, the smells of cooking greet us."
What does your Friday dinner look like?
"I was blessed with cooks around me.
From my side there is Persian-Tunisian cuisine, full of salads and an atmosphere of laughter, music, singing and joy.
From the side of my wife Ines, who is also a great cook, come the Ukrainian dishes, which are deep and spicy, with a lot of meat.
When we reach my mother-in-law, amazing smells come from the lobby of the building.
I usually do Kiddush, together with the children, who know it by heart.
At the end of the day, my fun after eating is passing out on the carpet, and having the kids jump on me like I'm some kind of inflator."
Do you have a special childhood memory from the weekends?
"As a child, I used to wake up on Shabbat to the sounds of Israeli music on Reshet Danzig and to the pale tracker skits that we knew by heart.
My father loved nature and we traveled a lot in the Land of Israel, usually to the north.
Every remote corner of the country made him proud in his heart.
He passed away three months ago from a serious illness, and for him Kiddush and Shabbat were the holy of holies, especially in the sense that the whole family should be together.
I recently released a poem in his memory called 'Watching Over You', which I created with Osher Cohen.
I believe he would be proud of this piece, which sanctifies the bond between father and son."
We will soon mark Israel's 74th Independence Day. As an ardent Zionist, what are your feelings about the holiday?
"Independence Day is a holy day for me, and part of my meaning and identity.
In Persia and Tunisia, my parents had to hide their Jewish identity, while I am an Israeli Jew who gets to live with his children in our country.
A week or two before Independence Day, I would climb trees and tie strings to the house with Israeli flags.
Today my Independence Day is full of performances, and we always meet an insanely happy crowd, celebrating that we can live the way we want.
We must make sure that our children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren also have this option, and remember that nothing here is taken for granted."

שישי שלה: אסתי זקהיים מברכת את השבת
"החלום שלי הוא לפתוח שולחן גדול ולהזמין את כל יקיריי המתים": ארוחת שישי שאסתי זקהיים חולמת עליה, ואיך היא מתמודדת עם העובדה שבעלה שומר שבת?
ספרי על ההכנות שלך לשבת
"ההכנות מתחילות כבר בחמישי בלילה, כשאני חוזרת מהצגה או מסדנה ומבשלת עד שלוש לפנות בוקר את כל מה שמצריך בישול ארוך כמו גולש, צלי ורטבים.
בשישי, בחלק הראשון של היום, אני מקדישה את הזמן לעצמי, לפגישה עם חברות וחברים לקפה, להצגה או לסרט, או שאני משתתפת בחזרות.
בקיץ השבתות נכנסות מאוחר, ויש לי הרבה זמן לשבת בגינה השכונתית ולצפות בשקיעה או סתם בסדרה טובה.
בארוחת השבת אני לרוב מארחת את אמא שלי, ורדה, שחגגה 89, וגם חברים".
יכולה לשתף עוד בבישולים?
"אני אוהבת קיצורי דרך.
למשל, במקום לקלף 10 בצלים, לחתוך ולבכות, אני קונה שקית בצל קפוא ומטגנת אותו.
על שולחן השבת שלי אפשר למצוא מנות בשר, מנות טופו טבעוניות, תפוחי אדמה וכרובית בתנור.
את רוב הבישולים אני מכינה, והם כמובן מתחממים על הפלטה בשבת.
אלחנדרו, בן זוגי, מכין מרק עוף, סלט ירקות ובחורף - את הצ'ולנט".
בעלך הוא אדם דתי ואת מבית חילוני.
איך זה עובד?
"לגור עם שומר שבת זו התפשרות אינסופית.
'ואהבת לרעך כמוך', הלכה למעשה.
לטיולים משפחתיים הוא לא יכול לצאת, אז מצאתי את עצמי הרבה פעמים אורזת את הילדים ומצטרפת לטיולי משפחות של חברים.
בנוסף, אני גם הנהגת התורנית של הילדים, זו שמחזירה אותם בשישי בלילה ממסיבות וממפגשים.
מצד שני, אני גם נהנית מיתרונות השבת שלו, כי בדרך כלל אני לא מופיעה בשבת ומקבלת מעין 'חופשה כפויה' - וטוב שכך".
את מי היית רוצה לארח בשבת?
"הייתי פותחת שולחן גדול ומזמינה את 'המתים שלי'.
לפעמים אני מדמיינת מה היה אילו אחי דניאל ז"ל היה בחיים, או אם אבא שלי, שניאור ז"ל, היה רואה את הילדים שלי: אוריאל (23) והתאומות תמרה ונעמה (16 וחצי).
בטח היינו רבים על כדורגל ופוליטיקה ומתמוגגים אלה מאלה".
יש לך זיכרון ילדות מיוחד מסופי השבוע?
"היינו משפחה חמה ומאוחדת.
בשישי בצהריים אמא היתה מכינה ערימת שניצלים, מביאה מהשוק חומוס ופיתות ושורפת חצילים לסלט טחינה.
אחר כך היינו נוסעים לדודה חנה ביד אליהו, או כמו שהיא היתה אומרת 'יד אליָיְקֶ'ה', והיא היתה מכינה בלינצ'סים.
מכיוון שרק אני לא אהבתי צימוקים, היא היתה מכינה לי כמה ללא צימוקים.
היא ראתה אותי, הקטנה שבאחים, ודאגה לי.
בשבתות היינו עושים סיור עם אבא שלי בנמל יפו, והוא היה מראה לנו מאיפה הוא ואחיו התאום, גרישה, הגיעו לארץ בלי כלום".
Her Friday: Esti Zakheim blesses the Shabbat
"My dream is to open a big table and invite all my dead loved ones": the Friday dinner Esti Zakheim dreams of, and how does she deal with the fact that her husband observes the Shabbat?
Tell me about your preparations for the Shabbat
"Preparations start already on Thursday night, when I return from a show or a workshop and cook until three in the morning everything that requires long cooking such as goulash, roasts and sauces.
On Friday, on the first part of the day, I dedicate the time to myself, meeting friends for coffee, a play or a movie, or I attend rehearsals.
In the summer, Saturdays start late, and I have a lot of time to sit in the neighborhood garden and watch the sunset or just watch a good series.
At Shabbat dinner, I usually host my mother, Varda, who just celebrated her 89th birthday, and also friends".
Can you share more about the cooking?
"I like shortcuts.
For example, instead of peeling 10 onions, cutting them and crying, I buy a bag of frozen onions and fry them.
On my Shabbat table you will have meat dishes, vegan tofu dishes, potatoes and cauliflower in the oven.
I prepare most of the dishes, and of course they heat up on the stove on Shabbat.
Alejandro, my partner, prepares chicken soup, vegetable salad and in the winter—the cholent".
Your husband is a religious person and you come from a secular home.
How does It work?
"Living with a Shabbat observant is an endless compromise.
'Love thy neighbor as thyself', practically.
He can’t go on family trips, so I often packed up the kids and joined friends’ family trips.
In addition, I am also the driver on duty for the children, the one who brings them back on Friday night from parties and gatherings.
On the other hand, I also enjoy the benefits of his Shabbat, because usually I don’t perform on Shabbat and get a sort of 'forced vacation'—and that’s a good thing".
Who would you like to invite for the Shabbat?
"I would set a big table and invite 'my dearly departed'.

Sometimes I imagine what would have happened if my brother, Daniel, God rest his soul, was alive, or if my father, the late Shneor, had seen my children: Uriel (23) and the twins, Tamara and Naama (16.5).
We would have probably argue about football and politics and be happy with each other".
Do you have a special childhood memory from the weekends?
"We were a warm and close family.
On Friday noon, my mother prepared a pile of schnitzels, bring hummus and pitas from the market and burn eggplants for a tahini salad.
Then we would go to Aunt Hana’s in Yad Eliyahu, or as she used to say, 'Yad Alyike', and she used to prepare blintzes.
Since I was the only one who didn’t like raisins, she made me some without raisins.
She saw me, the youngest of the siblings, and took care of me.
On Saturdays we would take a tour with my father in the port of Jaffa, and he would show us the place that he and his twin brother, Grisha, arrived to Israel without a thing".
Her Friday: Esti Zakheim welcomes the Sabbath.
"My dream is to set a big table and invite all my beloved deceased": This is the Friday dinner that Esti Zakheim dreams of, and how does she cope with the fact that her husband observes Shabbath?
Tell me about your preparations for Shabbat.
"The preparations start already on Thursday night, when I come back from a show or workshop and cook until three in the morning everything that requires long cooking like stew, roast and sauces."
On Friday, in the first part of the day, I dedicate my time to myself, meeting friends for coffee, going to a play or a movie, or participating in rehearsals.
In the summer, the Sabbath starts late, and I have plenty of time to sit in the neighborhood garden and watch the sunset or just a good series.
During the Sabbath meal, I usually host my mother, Vered, who just turned 89, and also friends.
Can you share more about the cooking?
"I love shortcuts.
For example, instead of peeling 10 onions, cutting and crying, I buy a bag of frozen onions and fry them.
On my Sabbath table, you can find meat dishes, vegan tofu dishes, baked potatoes and cauliflower.
I prepare most of the dishes, and of course, they are warmed up on the hotplate on Shabbat.
Alejandro, my partner, makes chicken soup, vegetable salad and in winter - the "cholent".

Your husband is a religious man and you're from a secular home.

"Living with a Shabbat watchman is an endless compromise.

Do you have a special memory of the weekend?
"We were a warm, united family.

פיינליסטית "אקס פקטור" ענבל ביבי תשתתף במחזמר "הלהקה"
ביבי השתתפה בעונה האחרונה של ״אקס פקטור״ וסיימה במקום השלישי •
היא תשחק בתפקיד נועה שאותו גילמה דפנה ארמוני
פיינליסטית ״אקס פקטור״, ענבל ביבי, לוהקה למחזמר ״הלהקה״ שיעלה בתיאטרון הארצי ותשחק בתפקיד נועה.
ביבי השתתפה בעונה האחרונה של ״אקס פקטור״ וסיימה במקום השלישי והמכובד.
כעת מתגלה שיש חיים אחרי הריאליטי והיא מצטרפת למחזמר ״הלהקה״.
ביבי תשחק בתפקיד נועה, שאותו גילמה דפנה ארמוני.
ביבי תצטרף לעמית פרקש, נאיה בינשטוק, ים רפאלי, נופר סלמאן, שי המבר, אלישע בנאי ועוד.

ג'ניפר לופז ובן אפלק התארסו
כמעט שני עשורים אחרי סיפור האהבה שלהם שנגמר בפרידה, לופז ואפלק חוזרים זה לזרועות זו •
לופז נפרדה משחקן הבייסבול אלכס רודריגז באפריל 2021
האחת שלו: כמעט שני עשורים אחרי סיפור האהבה הראשון שלהם שנגמר בפרידה ושנה לאחר הקאמבק המתוקשר, ג'ניפר לופז ובן אפלק סוגרים מעגל רומנטי ומאורסים.
את הידיעה המשמחת חלקה אתמול בערב (שישי) לופז עם מעריציה באתר הרשמי שלה onthejlo.com
הידיעה על האירוסין מגיעה לאחר שהשבוע תועדה לופז מסתובבת כשטבעת יהלום ענקית נראית בבירור על אצבע האירוסין שלה.
נציג מטעמה אישר למגזין פיפל כי אפלק ולופז אכן מאורסים.
כזכור, בפעם הקודמת שאפלק (49) שלף טבעת והציע ללופז (52) להיות שלו לנצח זה היה בשנת 2002, ואז היה מדובר בטבעת מנקרת עיניים עם יהלום ורוד ענק של שישה קראט, בשווי מוערך של כ-2.5 מיליון דולר.
למרות מחוות האהבה הגרנדיוזית, השניים נפרדו בשנת 2004, כשהם מאשימים את התקשורת באובססיביות יתר ובחיטוט בלתי פוסק בחייהם.
מאז אפלק הספיק להינשא לשחקנית ג'ניפר גארנר, אם שלושת ילדיו, ואילו לופז, כידוע, היתה נשואה כבר 3 פעמים בעבר, כולל לזמר מארק אנתוני, שיחד הפכו הורים לתאומים.
מערכת היחסים הרומנטית האחרונה של לופז היתה עם שחקן הבייסבול אלכס רודריגז, שממנו נפרדה באפריל 2021 לאחר מערכת יחסים בת ארבע שנים, כולל אירוסים של שנתיים.
Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck got engaged
Almost two decades after their love story that ended in separation, Lopez and Affleck return to each other’s arms •
Lopez split up from baseball player, Alex Rodriguez, in April 2021

His one and only: almost two decades after their first love story that ended in separation and a year after the publicized comeback, Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck are closing a romantic circle and are engaged.
Lopez shared the happy news with her fans yesterday evening (Friday) on her official website onthejlo.com
News of the engagement came after Lopez was spotted this week walking around with a huge diamond ring clearly visible on her engagement finger.
A representative confirmed to People magazine that Affleck and Lopez are indeed engaged.

Remember, the last time Affleck (49) pulled out a ring and proposed to Lopez (52) to be his forever it was in 2002, and then it was an eye-popping ring with a huge pink diamond of six carats, with an estimated value of about 2.5 million dollars.
Despite the grandiose gesture of love, the two separated in 2004, accusing the media of excessive obsession and incessant prying into their lives.

Since then, Affleck managed to marry actress Jennifer Garner, the mother of his three children, while Lopez, as we know, has already been married 3 times in the past, including to singer Marc Anthony, who together became parents to twins.
Lopez’s last romantic relationship was with baseball player, Alex Rodriguez, from whom she split in April 2021 after a four-year relationship, including a two-year engagement.

Lopez split from baseball player Alex Rodriguez in April 2021

His one: almost two decades after their first love story that ended in separation and a year after the publicized comeback, Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck are closing a romantic circle and are engaged.
Lopez shared the happy news with her fans yesterday evening (Friday) on her official website onthejlo.com
News of the engagement comes after Lopez was spotted walking around this week with a huge diamond ring clearly visible on her engagement finger.
A representative confirmed to People magazine that Affleck and Lopez are indeed engaged.

Remember, the last time Affleck (49) pulled out a ring and proposed to Lopez (52) to be his forever it was in 2002, and then it was an eye-popping ring with a huge pink diamond of six carats, with an estimated value of about 2.5 million dollars.
Despite the grandiose gesture of love, the two separated in 2004, accusing the media of excessive obsession and incessant prying into their lives.

Since then, Affleck managed to marry actress Jennifer Garner, the mother of his three children, while Lopez, as we know, has already been married 3 times in the past, including to singer Marc Anthony, who together became parents to twins.
Lopez's last romantic relationship was with baseball player Alex Rodriguez, from whom she split in April 2021 after a four-year relationship, including a two-year engagement.
